Vampire
This character is an unholy vampire, immortal and free from disease, but hated by all but their own kin.
Werewolf
This character bears the blood of the wolf, undying and powerful, but cursed with a savage, bestial form that emerges when the moon is full.
Zombie
This abomination is risen from the dead, and has no goals but to devour the flesh of men.
Mummy
Entombed and preserved long ago by the Egyptians, some force has brought this corpse back to life.
Djinn
Said to be made from fire as men were made from clay, these beings have many powers, though they usually do not meddle in human affairs.
God
This character is imbued with divine power. Immortal and powerful beyond most human imagination, these beings are literal gods among men.
Blood of the Gods
This character was not directly born of a god, but some of that powerful blood still remains.
Demi-god
While not a true god, this character possesses a substantial amount of divine blood. Demi-gods may not live forever, but they are a cut above other men in almost every way.
Wolf-blooded
This child has shown signs of sharing the blood of the wolf.
Fledgling
This child is the spawn of a vampire. It is not yet above diseases and even death, but will mature in time.
Half-Giant
This character is the child of a giant and a non-giant. An imposing sight, though perhaps not as tactful as most, half-giants are formidable opponents in combat.
Dragon
This character is a mighty dragon, powerful and very long lived. Dragons are wise, persuasive, and have a particular fondness for hoarding wealth.
Dragonborn
This character, though human, bears the blood of dragons and a small portion of their strength and wisdom.
Son of Solomon
This character is the leader of the resurrected Legion of Solomon.
Monster Hunter
This character has dedicated his life to the eradication of all monstrous creatures.
Novice Mage
The Novice Mage has dabbled in the arcane, but never learned much.
Eldritch Scholar
The Eldritch Scholar is well-versed in the wizarding arts, and can perform a range of spells.
of magical decay.
Veteran Wizard
Few powers elude the Veteran Wizard, but their exercise takes a toll on the body.
of magical decay.
Arcane Master
The Arcane Master is a wizard of unparalleled power. This character can perform miraculous feats, though at great cost.
of magical decay.
Magic Hertiage
This character's bloodline has a history of magical ability.  They may learn magic even if it would be otherwise unavailable, and they may pass this on to their children.
Giant
Twice over the height of men and tougher as well, the northern Giants are a fearsome sight in combat, though they lack the wisdom of common men.
Unworthy Priest
The personality and wealth of this priest are very inappropriate for [GetHerHis] position. And what's worse, [GetSheHe] has been unable to hide them from public view.

Luciferian
Sharing much of their theology with Catholics, but worshiping the fallen archangel Lucifer instead of The Holy Trinity, Satanists are despised throughout the Christian world.
Can have concubines.
Voodoo
A very loosely organized belief system centered around spirits and magic, the dark rituals of Voodoo are largely feared throughout the world.
Kemetic

The ancient Egyptians worshiped a pantheon of gods including Ra, Osiris, and Anubis. While their religion was loosely defined and not highly uniform, it remained dominant in Egypt for over 3,000 years before the common era.
Atenist

Under the rule of Akhenaten, it was declared the Aten, Ra-Horakhy who rejoices in the horizon, in his Name as the Light which is the sun disk, would be the sole god of Egypt.  With the rise of many monotheistic religions, this idea has once again gained prominence

Jotnar

The Jotnar faith shares almost all mythology with that of Norse pagans. Both groups believe in several distinct otherworldly realms, among them Asgard and Jotunnheim. While the Norse worship Odin and Thor, the lords of Asgard, the Jotnar worship the giants of Jotunnheim, among them Loki, Jormundgandr, and Fenrir.
Jotnar

The Jotnar faith shares almost all mythology with that of Norse pagans. Both groups believe in several distinct otherworldly realms, among them Asgard and Jotunnheim. While the Norse worship Odin and Thor, the lords of Asgard, the Jotnar worship the giants of Jotunnheim, among them Loki, Jormundgandr, and Fenrir.
Hellenic

The Hellenistic religion is polytheistic, with a pantheon of twelve major gods including Zeus, Aries, Athena, and Poseidon. It originated in ancient Greece and with the conquests of Alexander the Great and the Roman Empire, it would go on to become the dominant religion in the Mediterranean world until the rise of Christendom.
Roman

The Roman religion is polytheistic, with a pantheon of twelve major gods including Jupiter, Mars, Minerva, and Neptune. It originated as a blend of ancient Roman beliefs with the pantheon of the Greek religion, with the addition of an Imperial Cult venerating former emperors as gods.  It was the offical religion of the Roman Empire until its official conversion to Christianity under Emperor Theodosius I.

Celtic
Druidic

Celtic paganism is one of the last surviving branch of the ancient druidic belief systems. It features a pantheon of gods and a world full of spirits in which the children of Don rule the Skies, the Earth and the Otherworld. The main gods are Don and Lud, parents of the gods, Beli, the god of Healing, the Great Queen Rhiannon, the Horned god, called Amanaeth, Manawydan, the Sea God and Lleu of the Skillful Hand.

The reformed Celtic faith has a standardized liturgy etched on the many raised stones on the British Isles, telling the story of Don and her children. It is led by the circle of the Druids with the Arch-Druid as the religious leader of the faithful.
Draconic

The draconic faith is similar to many forms of European paganism and shares in many of their myths and legends.  However, instead of venerating the great heroes of men, it instead venerators the dragons in those tales.  The rituals of this religion are primarily concerned with the aquisition of precious metals as a way of strengthening ones soul for the next world and views fire as a sacred, cleansing force.
Draconic

The reformed draconic faith adopts standardized texts and rituals concerned with the purification and strengthening of the soul.  It views the world as a giant egg, and when it hatches, a new world will be born and everyone's place will be determines by their wealth in the old one.

Adopt Draconic Feudalism

Adopting Draconic Feudalism will convert all my Tribal Holdings into Castles. Where this occurs - if the County is big enough - City and Temple Holdings will also be created if they do not already exist. Your same rank tributaries will have their higher titles seized and your tributaries will be made into vassals. Your vassals are likely to follow suit if they are of your religion and culture.

Your same rank tributaries will have their higher titles seized and your tributaries will be made into vassals. Your vassals are likely to follow suit if they are of your religion and culture.

Adopting Draconic Mercantilism will convert all my Tribal Holdings into Cities. Where this occurs - if the County is big enough - Castle and Temple Holdings will also be created if they do not already exist. Four suitable Patrician families will be founded from within my tributes.

Werewolf Challenge Laws
In Werewolf culture, vassals may challenge rulers who are seen as unfit to rule.  If victorious, they may seize control of their realm.  Laws may be put in place to restrict when this can be done.
Traditional Werewolf Law
Traditionally, challenges may be brought against new, incapable, infamous, child, deformed, or weak rulers
Traditional
Infamy Reformed Werewolf Law
With this law, poor prestige or tyrannical rule are no longer grounds for a challenge
Infamy
Childhood Reformed Werewolf Law
With this law, challenges may only be brought against adults.
Child
Deformity Reformed Werewolf Law
With this law, genetic physical deformity is no longer grounds for a challenge
Deformity
Restricted Werewolf Law
Under restricted challenge laws, challenges may only be made once per lifetime, and only against new, incapable, or non-werewolf rulers.
Restricted
Rulers may be challenged over tyranny or negative prestige
Rulers may no longer be challenged over tyranny or negative prestige
Challenges may be brought against child rulers
Challenges may no longer be brought against child rulers
Rulers may be challenged over physical deformity
Rulers may no longer be challenged over physical deformity
Rulers may be challenged over physical weakness
Rulers may no longer be challenged over physical weakness
New rulers may be challenged for 5 years
New rulers may be challenged for 4 years
New rulers may be challenged for 3 years
Challengers must wait 2 years before issuing another challenge

The character has a well developed sense of justice - a trait much respected by vassals and courtiers.[ViceVirtue_Just]
column3: Ce personnage se caractérise par un sens aigu de la justice, ce qui lui vaut le respect de ses vassaux et courtisans.[ViceVirtue_Just]
column4: Der Gerechtigkeitssinn dieses Charakters ist gut ausgebildet - eine von Vasallen und Höflingen sehr geschätzte Eigenschaft.[ViceVirtue_Just]
column6: El personaje tiene un gran sentido de la justicia, un rasgo muy respetado entre vasallos y cortesanos.[ViceVirtue_Just]

column2: This character could not care less about justice - a character flaw that is not appreciated by vassals and courtiers.[ViceVirtue_Arbitrary]
column3: Ce personnage se moque de la justice, ce qui exaspère ses vassaux et ses courtisans.[ViceVirtue_Arbitrary]
column4: Dieser Charakter schert sich nicht um Gerechtigkeit – ein Charaktermakel, der von Vasallen und Höflingen nicht geschätzt wird.[ViceVirtue_Arbitrary]
column6: A este personaje no le podría importar menos la justicia, un defecto no apreciado entre vasallos y cortesanos.[ViceVirtue_Arbitrary]

column2: Lust, or 'Luxuria', the first deadly sin, enflames this character. These carnal desires are not appreciated by the Church, and might also cause problems out of the marital bed...[ViceVirtue_Lustful]
column3: La luxure, 'luxuria' en latin, enflamme ce personnage. De tels plaisirs charnels ne sont pas du goût de l'Église et peuvent être la source de nombreux problème en dehors du lit conjugal...[ViceVirtue_Lustful]
column4: Dieser Charakter wird von der Begierde, oder "Luxuria" getrieben - der ersten Todsünde. Diese Fleischeslüste werden von der Kirche nicht geschätzt und könnten auch außerhalb des Ehebetts zu Problemen führen ...[ViceVirtue_Lustful]
column6: El deseo sexual o 'luxuria', el primer pecado capital, invade a este personaje. Estos deseos carnales no están bien vistos por la Iglesia y pueden causar problemas fuera del matrimonio...[ViceVirtue_Lustful]

column2: Chastity, or 'Castitas' is the first of the seven virtues. Chaste characters are admired for their virtue and are unlikely to have extramarital affairs.[ViceVirtue_Chaste]
column3: À l'opposé de la luxure, la chasteté, 'castitas' en latin, est vue d'un bon œil et permet d'éviter les aventures extraconjugales.[ViceVirtue_Chaste]
column4: Keuschheit, bzw. "Castitas", ist die erste der sieben Tugenden. Keusche Charaktere werden für ihre Tugend bewundert und haben eher weniger außereheliche Affären.[ViceVirtue_Chaste]
column6: La castidad o 'castitas' es la primera de las siete virtudes. Los personajes castos son admirados por su virtud y es improbable que tengan relaciones extramatrimoniales.[ViceVirtue_Chaste]

column2: Pride, 'Superbia' is the seventh deadly sin according to the Church. However, proud characters tend to be ambitious and work hard to increase their Prestige.[ViceVirtue_Proud]
column3: L'orgueil, 'superbia' en latin, est le septième péché capital. Le bon côté, c'est qu'un personnage orgueilleux travaillera très dur pour améliorer son prestige.[ViceVirtue_Proud]
column4: Stolz, oder "Superbia", ist nach Ansicht der Kirche die siebte Todsünde. Stolze Charaktere tendieren aber dazu, ehrgeizig zu sein und hart für mehr Prestige zu arbeiten.[ViceVirtue_Proud]
column6: El orgullo o 'superbia' es el séptimo pecado capital según la Iglesia. Sin embargo, los personajes orgullosos suelen ser ambiciosos y trabajan duro para subir su Prestigio.[ViceVirtue_Proud]

column2: Humility, or 'Humilitas', is the seventh virtue and the opposite of Pride. Humble characters gain [Player.Religion.GetPietyName] where the proud gain Prestige. Humble characters tend to dislike prideful ones.[ViceVirtue_Humble]
column3: L'humilité, 'humilitas' en latin, est la septième vertu. L'humble travaille dur pour améliorer sa [Player.Religion.GetPietyName] et a tendance à ne pas apprécier l'orgueilleux.[ViceVirtue_Humble]
column4: Bescheidenheit oder "Humilitas" ist die siebte Tugend und das Gegenteil von Stolz. Bescheidene Charaktere erlangen [Player.Religion.GetPietyName], die stolzen Prestige. Bescheidene Charaktere tendieren zur Verachtung von stolzen Charakteren.[ViceVirtue_Humble]
column6: La humildad o 'humilitas' es la séptima virtud opuesta al orgullo. Los personajes humildes ganan [Player.Religion.GetPietyName], mientras que los orgullosos obtienen prestigio. Los primeros suelen rechazar a los últimos.[ViceVirtue_Humble]

column2: Gluttony, or 'Gula', is the second deadly sin and lacks positive effects. The Church despises gluttons, and so do members of the opposite sex.[ViceVirtue_Gluttonous]
column3: La gourmandise, 'gula' en latin, est le deuxième péché capital. Aucune vertu ne la rachète puisqu'à la fois les religieux et le sexe opposé la trouvent répugnante.[ViceVirtue_Gluttonous]
column4: Völlerei, oder "Gula", ist die zweite Todsünde und hat keine positiven Effekte. Sie wird von der Kirche und vom anderen Geschlecht verachtet.[ViceVirtue_Gluttonous]
column6: La glotonería o 'gula' es el segundo pecado capital y carece de efectos positivos. La Iglesia aborrece a los glotones, así como los miembros del sexo opuesto.[ViceVirtue_Gluttonous]

column2: Ambitious characters work harder, making them better at everything. However, their drive to reach the top means that they tend to make poor vassals...[ViceVirtue_Ambitious]
column3: Obsédé par sa réussite, ce personnage est souvent meilleur que les autres. Et comme il en est conscient, il fait rarement un bon vassal.[ViceVirtue_Ambitious]
column4: Ehrgeizige Charaktere arbeiten härter, weswegen sie bei allem besser sind. Ihr Streben an die Spitze macht sie allerdings zu dürftigen Vasallen ...[ViceVirtue_Ambitious]
column6: Los personajes ambiciosos trabajan duro y mejoran en aquello que se propongan. Sin embargo, este anhelo por llegar a la cima los convierte en malos vasallos...[ViceVirtue_Ambitious]

column2: Content characters are satisfied with their lot in life. They make loyal vassals but are unsuited to intrigue.[ViceVirtue_Content]
column3: Ce personnage se contente de la vie qu'il mène, ce qui en fait un vassal loyal, mais le rend inapte à l'intrigue.[ViceVirtue_Content]
column4: Zufriedene Charaktere sind mit ihrem Leben zufrieden. Sie geben gute Vasallen ab, sind aber nicht für Intrigen geeignet.[ViceVirtue_Content]
column6: Un personaje contento estará satisfecho con su suerte en la vida. Eso los convierte en vasallos leales, aunque inadecuados para asuntos de intriga.[ViceVirtue_Content]

column2: Trusting characters make poor spymasters, but good friends.[ViceVirtue_Trusting]
column3: Ce personnage est un excellent ami mais un piètre maître-espion.[ViceVirtue_Trusting]
column4: Treuherzige Charaktere sind schlechte Hofspitzel, aber gute Freunde.[ViceVirtue_Trusting]
column6: Los personajes confiados no sirven para jefe de espías, pero son amigos excepcionales.[ViceVirtue_Trusting]

column2: This character never shies from personal danger, enjoying the respect of vassals but the envy of cravens.[ViceVirtue_Brave]
column3: Ce brave ne baisse jamais les bras face au danger. Il suscite le respect des vassaux, tout comme l'envie des lâches.[ViceVirtue_Brave]
column4: Dieser Charakter scheut niemals vor Gefahren für das eigene Leben zurück. Dies bringt ihm den Respekt der Vasallen und den Neid der Feiglinge ein.[ViceVirtue_Brave]
column6: Este personaje nunca elude el peligro. Los vasallos lo respetan y los cobardes lo envidian.[ViceVirtue_Brave]

column2: This character believes in the virtue of 'Temperantia', moderation - a valuable trait in rulers and Stewards.[ViceVirtue_Temperate]
column3: Ce personnage croit en la vertu de la modération, 'temperantia' en latin, un trait de caractère précieux pour les intendants et les souverains.[ViceVirtue_Temperate]
column4: Dieser Charakter glaubt an die Tugend der "Temperantia", der Mäßigung. Dies ist für Herrscher und Kämmerer eine wertvolle Eigenschaft.[ViceVirtue_Temperate]
column6: Este personaje cree en la virtud de la moderación o 'temperantia', valiosa característica en soberanos y administradores.[ViceVirtue_Temperate]

column2: The character is infamously greedy. 'Avaritia', the third deadly sin, while not respected, does help squeeze out some extra tax income.[ViceVirtue_Greedy]
column3: Ce personnage est notoirement radin. L'avarice, 'avaritia' en latin, est le troisième péché capital. Parfait percepteur, il ne force pas le respect.[ViceVirtue_Greedy]
column4: Dieser Charakter ist für seine Gier berüchtigt, also "Avaritia", die dritte Todsünde. Er wird zwar nicht geschätzt, kann aber für zusätzliche Steuereinnahmen sorgen.[ViceVirtue_Greedy]
column6: El personaje es vergonzosamente codicioso. 'Avaritia' es el tercer pecado capital y, aunque no está bien visto, siempre viene bien para obtener unos ingresos extra.[ViceVirtue_Greedy]

column2: This character is famously charitable. 'Caritas' is the third of the seven virtues and a most chivalrous trait.[ViceVirtue_Charitable]
column3: La charité, 'caritas' en latin, est la troisième vertu. Ce personnage est connu pour sa bienveillance et sa générosité.[ViceVirtue_Charitable]
column4: Dieser Charakter ist für seine Wohltätigkeit berühmt. "Caritas" ist die dritte der sieben Tugenden und eine höchst ritterliche Eigenschaft.[ViceVirtue_Charitable]
column6: Este personaje es famoso por su generosidad. 'Caritas' es la tercera de las siete virtudes y un rasgo de caballerosidad.[ViceVirtue_Charitable]

column2: This character is shockingly lazy. 'Acedia', the fourth deadly sin, is an altogether negative trait.[ViceVirtue_Slothful]
column3: La paresse, 'acedia' en latin, est le quatrième péché capital et aucune vertu ne la rachète. Elle est particulièrement mal vue.[ViceVirtue_Slothful]
column4: Dieser Charakter ist erschreckend faul. "Acedia", die vierte Todsünde, ist eine durch und durch negative Eigenschaft.[ViceVirtue_Slothful]
column6: Este personaje es sorprendentemente vago. 'Acedia', es el cuarto pecado capital y, sin excepción, se considera algo negativo.[ViceVirtue_Slothful]

column2: This character is dutiful and diligent, the fourth of the seven virtues - 'Industria'.[ViceVirtue_Diligent]
column3: Le travail, 'industria' en latin, est la quatrième vertu. Ce personnage ne ménage pas sa peine pour travailler durement et remplir les devoirs de son rang.[ViceVirtue_Diligent]
column4: Diesem Charakter ist Pflicht und Fleiß wichtig - "Industria", die vierte der sieben Tugenden.[ViceVirtue_Diligent]
column6: Este personaje es responsable y trabajador, y representa la cuarta de las siete virtudes: 'industria'.[ViceVirtue_Diligent]

column2: This character is envious, the sixth deadly sin - 'Invidia'.[ViceVirtue_Envious]
column3: L'envie, 'invidia' en latin, est le sixième péché capital.[ViceVirtue_Envious]
column4: Dieser Charakter wird vom Neid verzehrt - "Invidia", der sechsten Todsünde[ViceVirtue_Envious]
column6: Este personaje es envidioso y comete el sexto pecado capital: 'invidia'.[ViceVirtue_Envious]

column2: This character is kind and full of empathy. The sixth virtue, 'Humanitas', is popular with vassals, but makes for a rather poor Spymaster.[ViceVirtue_Kind]
column3: Ce personnage est gentil et doué d'empathie. La sixième vertu, 'humanitas' en latin, est très appréciée des vassaux mais fait d'un personnage un piètre maître-espion.[ViceVirtue_Kind]
column4: Dieser Charakter ist gütig und voller Einfühlungsvermögen. Die sechste Tugend, "Humanitas", ist bei Vasallen sehr beliebt. Für Hofspitzel ist sie dagegen eher abträglich.[ViceVirtue_Kind]
column6: Este personaje es amable y derrocha empatía. La sexta virtud, 'humanitas', es popular entre los vasallos, pero es poco útil para jefes de espías.[ViceVirtue_Kind]

column2: The fifth deadly sin is Wrath, 'Ira', and this character certainly has a hot temper.[ViceVirtue_Wroth]
column3: La colère, 'ira' en latin, est le cinquième péché capital. Ce personnage a indéniablement un tempérament fougueux.[ViceVirtue_Wroth]
column4: Der Zorn, "Ira", ist die fünfte Todsünde ... und dieser Charakter hat ganz bestimmt ein hitziges Temperament.[ViceVirtue_Wroth]
column6: El quinto pecado capital es la ira y, por supuesto, este personaje tiene un carácter bastante fuerte.[ViceVirtue_Wroth]

column2: Patience, or 'Patientia', is the fifth of the seven virtues and the opposite of Wrath. Patient characters are just a little bit better at almost everything.[ViceVirtue_Patient]
column3: La patience, 'patientia' en latin, la cinquième vertu. Ce personnage affiche une grande patience et s'avère souvent un peu meilleur que les autres.[ViceVirtue_Patient]
column4: Patientia, die Geduld, ist die fünfte der sieben Tugenden und das Gegenteil des Zorns. Geduldige Charaktere sind fast in allen Belangen ein bisschen besser.[ViceVirtue_Patient]
column6: La paciencia o 'patientia' es la quinta de las siete virtudes y la opuesta a la Ira. Los personajes pacientes son un poco mejor en casi todo.[ViceVirtue_Patient]

column2: This character is a craven and a coward.[ViceVirtue_Craven]
column4: Dieser Charakter ist ein ängstlicher Feigling.[ViceVirtue_Craven]
column6: Este personaje es un gallina y un cobarde.[ViceVirtue_Craven]

column2: This character sees enemies in every shadow, unable to trust anyone.[ViceVirtue_Paranoid]
column3: Ce personnage voit des ennemis partout et n'a confiance en personne.[ViceVirtue_Paranoid]
column4: Dieser Charakter sieht in jedem Schatten einen Feind und kann niemandem vertrauen.[ViceVirtue_Paranoid]
column6: Este personaje ve enemigos en cada rincón, es incapaz de confiar en alguien.[ViceVirtue_Paranoid]

column2: This character is an evil sadist, taking pleasure in the suffering of others.[ViceVirtue_Cruel]
column3: Ce personnage aime voir souffrir ses semblables.[ViceVirtue_Cruel]
column4: Dieser Charakter ist ein boshafter Sadist und genießt es, andere zu quälen.[ViceVirtue_Cruel]
column6: Este personaje es un sádico malvado que siente placer haciendo sufrir a los demás.[ViceVirtue_Cruel]

column2: Lies do not come easily to this character, who values truth above all else. It is not a good trait for spymasters and plotters, but is respected among diplomats.[ViceVirtue_Honest]
column3: Ce personnage ne sait pas mentir et n'aime pas ça. Il fait un piètre maître-espion ou comploteur. En revanche, les diplomates apprécient ce trait.[ViceVirtue_Honest]
column4: Lügen kommen diesem Charakter nicht leicht über die Lippen, denn er schätzt die Wahrheit über alles. Dies ist keine gute Eigenschaft für Hofspitzel und Verschwörer, dafür aber unter Diplomaten geschätzt.[ViceVirtue_Honest]
column6: Rara vez mentirá este personaje, ya que valora la verdad ante todo. No es un buen rasgo para un jefe de espías o un complotador, pero se respeta entre los diplomáticos.[ViceVirtue_Honest]

Well-known to be prone to carnal sins, [GetSheHe] was often unfaithful to [GetHerHis] [GetHusbandWifeOpp]. [wicked_end]
Known to be Gluttonous, [GetSheHe] was constantly eating and rather overweight. [wicked_end]
A Greedy [GetManWoman], [GetSheHe] often remarked on the need to tax [GetHerHis] people into space. [wicked_end]
Prone to Sloth, [GetSheHe] never did anything [GetSheHe] did not have to. [wicked_end]
Ever Envious, [GetSheHe] always wanted what other people had. [wicked_end]
A Wroth [GetManWoman], people feared to cross [GetHerHim] - or even bring bad news. [wicked_end]
Guilty of the sin of Pride, [GetSheHe] wanted everyone to know of [GetHerHis] greatness. [wicked_end]
A Chaste [GetManWoman], [GetHerHis] honor was beyond refute. [pious_end]
Ever Temperate, [GetSheHe] never let [GetHerHis] base urges get the better of [GetHerHim]. [pious_end]
Well-known to be Charitable, [GetSheHe] freely gave money to [GetHerHis] friends and family. [pious_end]
A shining example of Diligence, [GetHerHis] duty was never neglected. [pious_end]
Known to be Kind, few had a bad word to say about [GetHerHim]. [pious_end]
Always Patient, [GetSheHe] never lost [GetHerHis] temper. [pious_end]
A humble [GetManWoman], [GetSheHe] never wanted anyone to make a fuss over [GetHerHis] accomplishments. [pious_end]
Never one to cower in the face of battle, [GetSheHe] was a shining pillar of bravery. [pious_end]
Ever seeking wealth, [GetHerHis] gold has purifier [GetHerHis] soul.  [pious_end]
Always seeking to find or steal wealth, [GetSheHe] has lived a life pleasing to Valefar, and surely serves him now
A proud [GetManWoman], [GetSheHe] was always ready to tell the tales of [GetHerHis] exploits so others may follow in [GetHerHis] footsteps.  [pious_end]
Having a firm sense of right and wrong, [GetSheHe] was not one to let injustice stand.  [pious_end]
Always setting [GetHerHis] sights on improving [GetHerHis] station, [GetSheHe] has left a strong mark on this world.  [pious_end]
Never present on the battlefield, [GetSheHe] has made a life of fear and cowardice.  [wicked_end]
Known for throwing away [GetHerHis] wealth to the unfortunate and disfavored, [GetSheHe] wasted the potential [GetHerHis] wealth brought [GetHerHim].  [wicked_end]
A humble [GetManWoman], many of [GetHerHis] accomplishments went unnoticed.  [wicked_end]
Prone to rash action and flights of fancy, [GetSheHe] offered no consistency or stability.  [wicked_end]
An unpleasant [GetManWoman], was constantly fearful of imaginary threats to [GetHerHis] reign.  [wicked_end]
A meek [GetManWoman], never had the stomach to do what needed to be done.  [wicked_end]
A cruel [GetManWoman], [GetSheHe] never felt as good and when [GetSheHe] was torturing prisoners.  [wicked_end]
A trusting [GetManWoman], [GetSheHe] was always willing to give people a change.  [pious_end]
Always fond of fair dealing and eager to tell the truth, few had to worry where they stood with [GetHerHim].  [pious_end]
A true lover of [GetMenWomenPreference], [GetSheHe] was always down for a good tumble.  [pious_end]
Fond of food and drink, [GetSheHe] was constantly throwing memorable banquets and feasts.  [pious_end]
Never one to waste time on activities that did not interest [GetHerHim], others would call [GetHerHim] slothful.  [pious_end]
A wroth [GetManWoman], [GetSheHe] was never one to suffer fools, nor to hide their displeasure.  [pious_end]
Always desiring what other people had, [GetSheHe] was never content with just their own gains.  [pious_end]
A strange [GetManWoman] who avoided the intimate pleasures this life can bring.  [wicked_end]
A dull [GetManWoman], [GetSheHe] never enjoyed the pleasures of excess or the camaraderie that accompanies great feasts.  [wicked_end]
Always throwing [GetHisHer] full attention into any trivial task, [GetSheHe] had little time for the joys of life.  [wicked_end]
A [GetManWoman] always content to wait for things to happen, [GetSheHe] let many opportunities to seize life pass by.  [wicked_end]
A dynamic [GetManWoman], [GetSheHe] seldom wasted time on thought or indecision, preferring immediate action.  [pious_end]
A [GetManWoman] with a taste for power, [GetSheHe] took delight in the personal joys of dominance and torture.  [pious_end]
A [GetManWoman] with no drive or ambition, [GetSheHe] sat by and let others take the opportunities that should have been [GetHersHis].  [wicked_end]
A wicked [GetManWoman], [GetSheHe] will surely pay for [GetHerHis] sins in the afterlife
A wicked [GetManWoman], [GetSheHe] will surely pay for [GetHerHis] sins in their next life
A weak and wicked [GetManWoman], [GetSheHe] will surely rot in Hel's domain
Despite [GetHerHis] failings, [GetSheHe] has a strong soul and will do well in the next world
An impure [GetManWoman], [GetSheHe] will surely pay for [GetHerHis] sins in the next world
An impious [GetManWoman], [GetHerHis] wicked life is over and [GetSheHe] resides with Tlaloc now
An impious [GetManWoman], [GetHerHis] wicked life is over and [GetSheHe] now chases the sun
An impious [GetManWoman], [GetHerHis] wicked life is over and [GetSheHe] is in Mictlan now
A wicked [GetManWoman], [GetSheHe] has surely fallen into Chakat-i-Daitih
A weak [GetManWoman], [GetSheHe] will suffer when [Religion.GetRandomGodName] comes into his glory
A godly [GetManWoman], [GetFirstName] is with [Religion.GetRandomGodName] now
A pious [GetManWoman], [GetSheHe] will be blessed in their next life
A warrior to the end, [GetFirstName] fights by Odin in Valhalla
A warrior at the end, [GetFirstName] is with Freyja in Fólkvangr now
[GetFirstName] has a strong, pure soul, and [GetSheHe] will do great things in the next world
Despite this, [GetSheHe] had an impure soul, and will struggle in the next world
A pious [GetManWoman], [GetHerHis] time in this world is over, and [GetSheHe] is in Tlalocan now
A pious warrior, [GetSheHe] chases the sun now
A pious [GetManWoman], [GetHerHis] time in the middle world is over and [GetSheHe] is in Mictlan now
A good [GetManWoman], [GetSheHe] rests in paradise now
[GetFirstName] lived [GetHerHis] life to the fullest, and will be with [Religion.GetRandomGodName] on the day of his glory
we hope [GetFirstName] will find peace in the afterlife
we hope [GetFirstName] will find peace in [GetHerHis] next life
we hope [GetFirstName] will find joy in Helgafjell
[GetHerHis] purity will give [GetHerHim] strength in the next world
perhaps [GetSheHe] will overcome [GetHerHis] impurity in the next world
we hope [GetFirstName] will find peace in the next world
we hope [GetFirstName] will find peace in Tlalocan
we hope [GetFirstName] will find peace following the sun
we hope [GetFirstName] will find peace in Mictlan
Myth and Magic

Long before the renaissance, when the old gods were still strong and the world was not so well known, men of myth and magic still walked the Earth, though their deeds are now forgotten. Giants roamed in the north, undying men with the blood of wolves and bats inspired the fear of the world, and some dabbled in the mystical arts. Through the ages their history became legend, and legend became myth, but in another time, they might instead thrive.
Myth and Magic

Long before the renaissance, when the old gods were still strong and the world was not so well known, men of myth and magic still walked the Earth, though their deeds are now forgotten. Giants roamed in the north, undying men with the blood of wolves and bats inspired the fear of the world, and some dabbled in the mystical arts. Through the ages their history became legend, and legend became myth, but in another time, they might instead thrive.

Chief and first among the wolfmen, Velnias leads his small clan as they struggle to survive in a world that fears and does not understand them. Some say the blood of the wolf is a curse, but it may prove to be a blessing...

Brynjolf is among the last few of the old and simple race of giants. His people were made into myths and hunted nearly to extinction by the Northmen who feared them as evil gods, and now they scrape out a living in the far northern mountains, waiting for their chance to return.

The infamous Vlad the Impaler was known for his brutality. To strike fear into the hearts of his enemies, he made examples of entire towns, impaling the villagers on spikes for all to see. But some say his cruelty was more than just malice, and that he not only killed, but was an undead abomination himself that fed upon the blood of the living. Was he cursed by God... or blessed by the Devil?

As Christianity spread throughout Europe, it brought with it teachings that minimized or even demonized the magical arts. As the years passed, court wizards faded into obscurity and no longer had the trust of their Lords. Rhodric is one of few left who still believe in them, and even has some magical talents of his own..

Argos of Achaia is a proud man who believes in faith and tradition. His family through the generations watched as Rome adopted Christianity, then split in two and has declined ever since. In Argos' mind, this is no coincidence, and he strives to return to the traditional Greek faith. Will he relent and pray to the God of his Basileus, or press even harder to return to the glory of the past?

The dragons were once a proud and prolific race, respected for their wisdom and feared for their strength. Over the ages, fear won over respect, and men betrayed and hunted down the mythical beasts whose corpses now litter the world. "Dragonslayers" were praised as heroes, while their victims were condemned as monsters. Rugarth and his family are the only dragons left in the world, on an island so cut off from it that they and the humans there live in peace.
This option is available due to you having the Philosopher's Stone
A monster is found

The rumors about [accused_apostate.GetTitledName] brewing here in [Root.Location.GetName] seem to be true - [accused_apostate.GetSheHe] is a werewolf, an unholy ambomination who feeds on the flesh of men.

The rumors about [accused_apostate.GetTitledName] brewing here in [Root.Location.GetName] seem to be true - [accused_apostate.GetSheHe] is a vampire, an unholy ambomination who feeds on the blood of men.
The [Root.Liege.GetTitle] must know!
The [Root.Liege.GetTitle] must know!
Openly follow the Hellenic or Roman religion
Alchemy Success
Success! You have done what was thought to be impossible and turned iron into gold.
Marvelous!
Alchemy Failure
You set out to turn iron into gold, but it seems you've somehow managed to turn all of the gold into iron.
Damn.
Summoning Success
The ethereal army has arrived just as planned. Your other soldiers are somewhat ill at ease, but you simply tell them that the ghosts are their ancestors to put their fears to rest.
As I completed the spell, a trumped sounded and a group of angelic looking soldiers clad in white came in from over the horizon to offer assistance.
Shortly after completing the spell, a group of unfamiliar soldiers joined our camp.  They spoke to no one, but it was clear why they were here: they are einherjar, sent by Heimdall to aid us.
After the spell completed, a new group of men appeared amongst our soldiers - their mu'aqqibat, given flesh to protect us.
When the spell completed, a spectral host appeared before me - the very cyhyraeth moaning of our deaths now forced to protect our lives.
By using ancient heka, I have pulled the ba of many soldiers who have died her before back into the land of the living to fight again.
With my spell, I rended a hole in the ground, and from it came forth a host from Múspell.  They claimed it was not time for their battle, but were eager to spill the blood of men for practice.

Nearly everywhere is the world has been a battlefield at some point, strewn with unburied corpses whose souls will be turnt away by Charon.  With my magic, I have given them life again, albeit temporarily.

As I cast the spell and spilled blood on the group, the blood opened into a chasm, unendingly deep, and from it sprang an army of hellish knight, offering service in exchange for even a brief reprieve from their captivity.

With the spell, I was able to communicate with the itse of those who died in the area but were unable to enter Tuonela.  In exchange for their service in battle, I will gather their remains for a proper burial.
I have communicated with many souls from Mictlan.  I will pull them back to the center world for them to fight again in hopes of a chance accompanying the sun.
To prepare for battle, I have created a series of golems, and placed papers with shem in their mouths.  They will fight until the war is one, then I shall remove the shem to end their fighting.
Needing a powerful army, I have used my magic to pull a horde of Rakshasa back to earth.  Fortunately, their stay is temporary.  After the war, they will be pulled back to the patala.
Gathering the bodies of the fallen from graves and battlefields, I have put life back in them to have them fight on as zombies.
Excellent.
Summoning Failure
The ethereal army was summoned successfully, but it seems to be fighting for the wrong side.
Oops.
Mysterious Ghost Army
A strange army of what appears to be ghosts has materialized near your forces. At first your men were terrified, but they seem to be friendly.
Uhh... right, then.
The Search for Solomon

Legends say that the great king Solomon once held a powerful ring that allowed him great powers. Some say he could even command a legion of djinn to do his bidding. The man who possessed this ring would be powerful indeed.
We must have it!
Meaningless superstition.
Seal of Solomon not Found
Despite your men's best efforts, no sign has yet been uncovered of this powerful ring of Solomon. Some doubt it even exists.
Try harder!
Oh well...
Seal of Solomon
At last! Your men return from their quest and hand you the legendary Seal of Solomon. As you place it on your finger, you know that your kingdom's power will know no bounds.
Glorious!
Djinni Powers Awaken
As one of the Djinn, you excell in what mortal men would call magic. While some such men dabble in these arts, your powers go beyond what they will ever achieve.
Indeed.
Son of Solomon
You now lead Solomon's Legion, and can truly call yourself as great as King Solomon himself.
Glorious!
Solomon's Legion Lost
You have lost control of Solomon's Legion, and all of the prestige that goes with it.
Damn.
Rumors of the Stone

With your recent successes in alchemy, you've gained an interest in the legendary Philosopher's Stone. It is said that it not only allows easy transmutation, but can even make one immortal. While the secrets to crafting it have long been lost, rumors have reached you of fragments buried with long-dead wizards. With enough of these, you could re-forge a whole Stone.
I must have it!
A mere old superstition.
Stone Not Found
Your men have returned empty-handed. The graves they dug up were filled only with useless relics and bones.
Search harder!
Perhaps it is a waste of time.
Stone Found

Success! Your men returned with enough pieces of the material that you were able to assemble the Philosopher's Stone. As you first hold it in your hands, you know that untold wealth and power will be yours for all time.
Glorious!
Satanists Expelled
The devil-worshippers have been expelled from our holy realm. We hope to never see their kind again.
Good riddance.
The Knights of Helsing

With the rise of ungodly monsters laying waste to the world, an increasing number of men loyal to the church have begun to organize against them. A Dutch scholar by the name of Van Helsing has founded an order of knights for these so called monster hunters, in the hopes that they might fight back against the growing hordes of demons.
Godspeed to them.
Monster Hunter
After spending many weeks with your fellow knights training in ways to hunt the demons of the world, you feel you can truly call yourself a monster hunter.
I shall fear no evil.
Wife Impregnated by Zeus
Your wife has told you a strange tale. She recounts how last night as she was going for a walk, a beautiful swan appeared to her. Unable to resist its charms, she spent the night in its embrace.
... What?!
Impregnated by Zeus
You recall a strange dream last night in which a beautiful swan appeared to you and seduce you. Of course, you pass off this dream as mere nonsense.
Still, how strange.
Quest Begins
You have assembled your party and made all preparations. Now you need only decide to where your quest will take you.
I shall seek the golden fleece.
I shall slay the legendary gorgon, Medusa.
On second thought, these quests sound dangerous.
Fleece

You have followed rumors of the fleece to a remote land across the Black Sea. An old man, claiming to be king in these lands, tells you that he posesses it, and will give it to you only if you should pass three arduous trials, any of which may claim your life.
Bring on your trials, sir.
These trials sound dangerous...
Fleece Oxen

You arrive at the first of your trials, where you are told you must plow a field. You rejoice at the trial's ease when you see two oxen ready to pull your plow, until you realize that the oxen are ablaze with magical fire.
I must tame these unholy beasts!
Fleece Army

You return from the field, singed but alive. The old man tells you that you must now sow the same field, and hands you what he claims are dragon's teeth to sow. Reluctantly, you spread them throughout the field. To your horror, an army of soldiers soon sprouts from the ground and moves against you.
To arms, men! We must repel these demons!
Cast a stone amongst them to confuse the host.
Fleece Dragon

The battle was fierce, but you eventually emerge victorious. The old man, who you've come to resent, takes you to a large cave and tells you that the fleece awaits within. You enter, and find that he speaks the truth... but a dragon stands guard in front of it.
Attempt to steal the fleece from the dragon.
Persuade the dragon that you are a worthy bearer of the fleece.
Fleece Dragon

Your stone causes chaos among the ranks of your enemy, causing them to turn on one another. You make quick work of those that remain. The old man takes you to a large cave and tells you that the fleece awaits within. You enter, and find that he speaks the truth... but a dragon stands guard in front of it.
Attempt to steal the fleece from the dragon.
Persuade the dragon that you are a worthy bearer of the fleece.
Fleece Success
As if the burns from the oxen weren't enough, the dragonfire stings hot as you quickly snatch the fleece and flee the cave. You are victorious, though some of your men were not so lucky.
A glorious victory.
Fleece Victory

You speak with the dragon for hours, discussing many topics and even enjoying yourself in the process. Night has fallen when the dragon decides that you are indeed worthy of the fleece, which it hands to you and bids you good fortune.
The fleece is mine at last.
Medusa
You arrive at the supposed location of Medusa, a hideous gorgon whose very gaze is said to turn men to stone.
This beast cannot be suffered to live.
On second thought, it sounds like a frightening creature.
Medusa

You enter the beast's lair, and see evidence of its horrible powers. Unbelivably life-like statutes of men litter the cavern, and reflective steel lines several walls, perhaps to allow the beast to find its prey more easily. You see movement on the far side of the room.
Close your eyes and attempt to fight the beast.
Use the mirrored walls to fight the beast without looking directly at it.
Medusa
The fight is difficult without the benefit of your sight, but you eventually succeed in killing the hideous gorgon. You take its head as a prize, careful not to look at it while you do so.
Another fell beast removed from the world.
Medusa

Using the walls, you find the monster stalking you from behind a pillar. Remarkably, it doesn't seem to notice the same technique, and you surprise it, severing its head in a single blow. Careful not to meet even its dead gaze, you take the head as a trophy.
A glorious victory.
Zeus
You had your fun last night, but it may not be without consequence.
Oh well.
Zeus
It has been a long time since you indulged your carnal desires. You decide to head down to the realm of mortals for some fun.
OK
Set Seduction for Zeus
You are Zeus, God-King of Olympus, and you have achieved all anyone could dream of. Except perhaps a few more pleasures of Earthly flesh...
Why not?
Wicked Priest

A priest of the Draconic faith is expected to maintain a certain lifestyle and degree of wealth.  While not every dragon obtains riches in an instant, your horde appears to be particularly small.  Gossip has started to spread, and people say your lack of wealth is a sign of your lacking faith.

A priest of the Draconic faith is expected to uphold certain standards of morality and strength. But we are only human after all, and as long as people aren't aware of your vices and faults it's not a problem. However, it seems you've been slipping in discretion lately - gossip is starting to spread, and there are murmurings all over the Norse world about your unworthy traits and habits.
I must do better.

The spirits of the dead live side by side with the world of the living, but the assanyi tell me you have chosen to break this cycle.  Gossip has started to spread and there are mumurs amongst the people and the spirits.

A priest communicating with the spirits is expected to lead various ceremonies.  While the occasional missed event can be overlooked, people have noticed that you have been slacking in your duties.  Gossip has started to spread and there are mumurs amongst the people and the spirits.
May the spirits judge me favorably.

A Druid is expected to uphold certain standards of morality and strength. But we are only human after all, and as long as people aren't aware of your vices and faults it's not a problem. However, it seems you've been slipping in discretion lately - gossip is starting to spread, and there are murmurings all over the Norse world about your unworthy traits and habits.
May the Gods still judge me favorably.
A priest in service of the gods is expected to uphold certain standards of purity while performing their duties.  The gods have taken note of you vices and are displeased.
May the Gods still judge me favorably.

A priest of the Jotun faith is expected to uphold certain standards of morality and strength. But we are only human after all, and as long as people aren't aware of your vices and faults it's not a problem. However, it seems you've been slipping in discretion lately - gossip is starting to spread, and there are murmurings all over the Norse world about your unworthy traits and habits.
May the Gods still judge me favorably.

A priest of the gods is expected to uphold certain standards of devotion. But we are only human after all, and as long as people aren't aware of your vices and faults it's not a problem. However, it seems you've been slipping lately - gossip is starting to spread, and there are murmurings that your faith has waned.
May the Gods still judge me favorably.
Though illness tried to overtake me, it is no match for the divine power that courses through my veins.
It will take more than that to bring me down.
Though fate and chance conspired against me, my body has mended itself back into its divine form.
All is as it should be.
Stumbling from my bed, I took the vial of Panacea.  Almost immediately, all feeling of illness left my body.
I feel like I've been born anew
After hearing of my illness, [From.GetTitledName] brought me a special medicine that [From.GetSheHe] has prepared.  [From.GetSheHeCap] claimed it was able to cure any illness.
Cures anything? I'll take it!
I don't have any need for that
It must be poison! Guards!
For the feast's entertainment, I've been considering using my magic to draw in beings from anothr realm to otherworldly music for us.
I'll take proper precautions, of course.
I'll just hire some locals instead
To entertain my guests, I've been thinking of enchanting a number of instruments to play themselves.
It will be a spectacle for both the ears and the eyes.
I'm sure silence will be fine.
It's become very clear that the wolves, not the sheep, rule this country.  With the balance of power in my favor, I have revealed myself and taken my rightful place.
I am a werewolf!
Re-establish Roman Paganism
Religio Romana et Mos Maiorum

With our reclaiming of Rome, it is time for us to restore our ancient pious traditions.  We once honored the gods more properly than any other, and in return they made us strong, and so it shall be again.  As pater patriae and pontifex maximus, I will lead these restored rites and restored Rome to a new glory!
Fas et iura requirent!
Your court and vassals will be offered conversion.
Potion Completed
Finally, your potion is complete.  You'll give it to [From.GetTitledFirstName] tonight and see what happens.
I'm sure this will turn out well.
Potion Success!
While they don't love me yet, [target_potioned.GetTitledFirstName] seems a lot more receptive to my advances now.
Now I'm getting somewhere!
Potion Success
Success! The potion worked marvelously, and your love life seems better already.
Excellent.
Potion Failure!
Failure! Not only did the potion not generate any feelings of love, but it seems like [target_potioned.GetTitledFirstName] hates my guts, now!
This could be a problem...
Potion Failure!
Failure! [target_potioned.GetTitledFirstName] seems even more distant now.
Curses!
Potion Failure!
Failure! Not only has the potion failed to induce any romance, but it seems to have had some... unintended consequences.
Curses!
Potion Failure!
When I went to speak to [target_potioned.GetTitledFirstName], I found that not only did [target_potioned.GetSheHe] not love me, [target_potioned.GetSheHe] had just taken a vow of celibacy!
This is terrible!
Spell Cast
The spell has been completed.  Soon you should begin to reap what you've sown
[target_conversion_caster.Religion.GetRandomGodName] will be pleased
Religious Conversion
The spell was cast successfully, and already your errant followers begin to appreciate the true faith.
Excellent.
Spread of False Gods
The spell was a failure. Not only was the province not converted, but their false worship seems to have spread
This is terrible!
Attraction
For some reason, I've found the idea of being in love with a [target_potioner.GetManWoman] less and less appealing.
Perhaps a [target_potioner.GetManWomanOpp] would catch my fancy...
Attraction
Recently, I've been feeling a strange romantic attraction towards another [target_potioner.GetManWoman] in the court.
Does this mean I'm...
Rival
Lately, every little thing [target_potioner.GetTitledFirstName] does seems to infuriate me.  When will someone shut [target_potioner.GetHerHim] up?
I really do hate that [target_potioner.GetManWoman].
Chastity
The pleasures of the flesh have had less and less appeal to me.
I will focus on more important things now.
Celibacy
Recently, it feels as if I could bear to live in complete celibacy for the rest of my life.
column3: Récemment, je me sens capable de rester chaste pour le restant de mes jours.
column4: Vor kurzem, als könne ich den Rest meines Lebens im Zölibat verbringen.
column6: Recientemente parece que podría ser célibe el resto de mi vida.

column2: Let's do it!
Maybe later

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has declared the restoration of the old Roman traditions and ceremonies of religion.  With this, [From.GetSheHe] has also declared [From.GetHerHis] own divinity and re-established the imperial cult.
The gods favor us!
[From.GetSheHeCap] is no god.
[From.GetBestName] has begun to revive the old traditions of Rome.  Once, they worshipped us and we game them strength.  Perhaps it is time to return to these ways.
Do ut Des
No, things are fine as they are.
Roman Rebirth

Under the rule of [From.GetTitledName], the Roman religious structure and rituals have been restored.  With [d_roman_pagan.Holder.GetTitledFirstName] as the Ponifex Maximus, this could lead to a new age of Roman conquest.
Rome rises again!
Rome had its time.
They fell once, they'll fall again.

With the burgeoning rebirth of Rome, it seems clear that we should also return to our old ways of worship.  Rome honored the gods and the gods favored Rome.  When we lost their favor, we fell from glory.
I'll propose this to my liege
We're doing well the way we are.

My [From.GetJobTitle], [From.GetTitledFirstName], has approached me with an interesting suggestions.  Rome grew strong with the favor of the gods, and [From.GetSheHe] feels that we should restore these old traditions to better honor them.
Sit romana potens propago
Under the gods of Rome we grew weak. Under the gods of Greece we renewed our strength.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has heeded my advice and restored the old rites, naming me Pontifex Maximus. With the gods in our favor, Rome will rule eternal.
The gods favor us!
With the rites and rituals of Rome restored, people may question my adherence to the Greek ways.  Perhaps I would better serve the gods using this reborn way.
This is not how to honor the gods, but I need to act the part for now.

relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned and brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] an icon of a saint. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] has proof that it was not made by human hands. but appeared miraculously! This is surely a gift from [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName].

relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned and brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] an icon of a saint. The quality is great and the symbolism is plentiful.  This is a sacred image, worthy of veneration.
My true treasures lie not in this world, but in heave. I have vowed to live the life of an §YAscetic§!
There are more joys in this world than I dreamed.  I have given up my life as an §YAscetic§!
You have destroyed the graven icon “[FromFrom.GetName]”
You have sold your [FromFrom.GetName] and given the money to the less fortunate
I have finished my education but without any clear purpose. I found some joy in studying magic but without guidance I didn't do very well.
column3: J'ai achevé mon éducation, mais sans définir d'objectif précis. J'ai certes une affinité pour la magie, mais faute d'orientation, je n'ai pas excellé dans cette discipline.
column4: Ich habe meine Ausbildung ohne klare Aufgabe abgeschlossen. Das Studium der Magie war phasenweise anregend, aber wenn ich keine Hilfe hatte, waren meine Ergebnisse nicht besonders gut.
column6: He terminado mi educación, pero sin ninguna finalidad clara. Encontré alguna alegría en el estudio de la magia pero sin guía no lo hago muy bien.

column2: Familiar Decision

You have spent much time honing your magical skills, but have realized that they could be taken even further. Summoning a familiar could raise your potential to new heights, though the process could be costly and time consuming.
Attempt to summon a dove.
Attempt to summon a wolf.
Attempt to summon a raven.
Attempt to summon a cat.
Attempt to summon an owl.
I can't afford this...
Familiar Result
Your attempt to summon a familiar was a success! You now have a new magical companion to aid you.
Maybe I'll name it too...
Familiar Decision
Your attempt to summon a familiar was a failure! Despite months of effort, you're left with nothing but a disturbing pile of mixed animal parts on your summoning table.
Uh... someone clean this up, please.
Magical Upbringing Conclusion
You were trained in the art of magic from an early age, but it didn't go very well.
You were trained in the art of magic from an early age, and the effort was more or less successful.
You were trained in the art of magic from an early age, and it paid off well.
You were trained in the art of magic from an early age, and you excelled in every way.
Oh well.
Alright.
Good.
Excellent.
Magic Education Complete
Young [From.GetFirstName] has finished [From.GetHerHis] education in magic. It turned out less well than expected.
column3: [From.GetFirstName] a terminé sa formation en magie. Ça s'est moins bien passé que prévu.
column4: Die Magie Lehrzeit von Klein [From.GetFirstName] ist abgeschlossen. Die Ergebnisse sind nicht so gut wie erhofft.
column6: El/la joven [From.GetFirstName] ha terminado [From.GetHerHis] estudios de magia. Resultó menos bien de lo esperado.

column2: Young [From.GetFirstName] has finished [From.GetHerHis] education in magic. It seems [From.GetSheHe] has learned all the basic skills required.
column3: [From.GetFirstName] a terminé sa formation en magie. On dirait qu'[From.GetSheHe] a appris toutes les techniques de base requises.
column4: Die Magie Lehrzeit von Klein [From.GetFirstName] ist abgeschlossen. Scheinbar hat [From.GetSheHe] die grundlegenden Kenntnisse erworben.
column6: El/la joven [From.GetFirstName] ha terminado [From.GetHerHis] estudios de magia. Al parecer [From.GetSheHe] ha aprendido todas las habilidades básicas requeridas.

column2: Young [From.GetFirstName] has finished [From.GetHerHis] education in magic. It is evident that [From.GetSheHe] has excelled in [From.GetHerHis] studies.
column3: [From.GetFirstName] a terminé sa formation en magie. Il est indéniable qu'[From.GetSheHe] y a excellé.
column4: Die Magie Lehrzeit von Klein [From.GetFirstName] ist abgeschlossen, und das mit ausgezeichneten Resultaten.
column6: El/la joven [From.GetFirstName] ha terminado [From.GetHerHis] estudios de magia. S evidente que ha destacado en [From.GetHerHis] estudios.

column2: Young [From.GetFirstName] has finished [From.GetHerHis] education in magic. I notice with pride that [From.GetSheHe] has attained nothing less than a masterful level of knowledge.
column3: [From.GetFirstName] a terminé ses études en magie. Je remarque avec fierté qu'[From.GetSheHe] a atteint un remarquable niveau de connaissance.
column4: Die Magie Lehrzeit von Klein [From.GetFirstName] ist abgeschlossen. Voller Stolz stelle ich fest, dass [From.GetSheHe] ein wahrhaft meisterhaftes Niveau erreicht hat.
column6: El/la joven [From.GetFirstName] ha terminado [From.GetHerHis] estudios de magia. Veo con orgullo que [From.GetSheHe] ha alcanzado nada menos que un nivel magistral de conocimiento.

column2: Oh well.
Very good.
This pleases me.
Secret Exposed!
Not only did that cur, [From.GetTitledName] find out my secret, but now [From.GetSheHe]'s let everyone know that I'm a werewolf!
Now My life is in danger!
What a fool.
Werewolf Discovered
I've heard terrible news from [From.GetTitledName].  It turns out that [target_discovered_werewolf.GetTitledName] is a werewolf, preying upon our people and livestock!
According to [From.GetTitledName], [target_discovered_werewolf.GetTitledName] is a mighty werewolf!
[From.GetTitledName] has been telling everyone that [target_discovered_werewolf.GetTitledName] is a werewolf.  I don't think they know my true nature, though.
[From.GetTitledName] has been telling everyone that [target_discovered_werewolf.GetTitledName] is another werewolf.
They're a monster!  They have to be destroyed.
Maybe I can use this to my advantage.
If you have the authority, you'll have reason to arrest and execute [target_discovered_werewolf.GetTitledName].
This is a blessing.
They'll only waste this power.
I'm not worried
This is the perfect time for me to reveal myself
Other characters will find out and may be intimidated.
He's in good company.
Perhaps we can become friends.
Vassal Werewolf
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has informed me that my vassal, [target_discovered_werewolf.GetTitledName], is a vicious werewolf, preying on the people of my land.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has informed me that my vassal, [target_discovered_werewolf.GetTitledName], is werewolf.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has informed me that my vassal, [target_discovered_werewolf.GetTitledName], is vicious werewolf.  I don't think he knows the truth about me.
According to [From.GetTitledName], [target_discovered_werewolf.GetTitledName] is another werewolf!
Arrest [target_discovered_werewolf.GetHerHim]! And bring silver weapons!
I'll give [target_discovered_werewolf.GetHerHim] one chance.
Our ranks swell.
This is no concern of mine.
Perhaps I could let [target_discovered_werewolf.GetHerHim] go, but [target_discovered_werewolf.GetSheHe]'ll owe me
[target_discovered_werewolf.GetTitledName] will hear your offer.
Werewolf Discovered

My snoops have uncovered most disturbing news about [target_discovered_werewolf.GetTitledName].  It appears that [target_discovered_werewolf.GetSheHe] is the werewolf that has been stalking our lands at night, killing our people.  How should I use this information?
I'll expose [target_discovered_werewolf.GetHerHim] to everyone!
Expose [target_discovered_werewolf.GetTitledName], giving me reason to arrest and execute [target_discovered_werewolf.GetHerHim]
I should inform [target_discovered_werewolf.Liege.GetTitledName]
Inform [target_discovered_werewolf.Liege.GetTitledName] and let [target_discovered_werewolf.Liege.GetHerHim] handle it.
Blackmail [target_discovered_werewolf.GetHerHim] to stay out of factions.
Blackmail [target_discovered_werewolf.GetHerHim] to stay out of factions.
Blackmail [target_discovered_werewolf.GetHerHim] to join my faction.
Blackmail [target_discovered_werewolf.GetHerHim] to join my faction.
I'll keep this to myself
Don't tell anyone
I think I've had enough of this
Stop spying on [target_discovered_werewolf.GetTitledName]
Monster found!
[From.GetTitledName] has informed me of some disturbing news – it appears that [target_discovered_werewolf.GetTitledName] is secretly a werewolf! A monster hiding among us!
[From.GetTitledName] has informed me that [target_discovered_werewolf.GetTitledName] is actually a werewolf.  I don't think [From.GetSheHe] knows about my state. How should I handle this?
Everyone must be told
Werewolf Revealed
After I was caught, [From.GetTitledName] revealed [From.GetReflexivePronoun] as a werewolf as well.
I appreciate the solidarity.
Werewolves Everywhere!
After [target_discovered_werewolf.GetTitledName] was discovered, it seems more werewolves are coming out of the woodwork.  [From.GetTitledName] is one too!
We're surrounded by monsters!
Our ranks grow.
Packmates?
After I was caught, [From.GetTitledName], another known werewolf, offered my [From.GetHerHim] hand... or would that be paw... in friendship
I need every friend I can get
I don't think that's a good idea
Packmates
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has accepted my offer of friendship
Wonderful news.
Rejection
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has rejected my offer of friendship
I hope [From.GetSheHe] knows what [From.GetSheHe]'s doing.
A Favor for a Secret
[From.GetTitledName] has informed me that [From.GetSheHe] is aware that I am a werewolf.  [From.GetSheHeCap] is willing to keep my identity a secret, but at a cost.
I'll owe [From.GetHerHim] a favor.
I refuse to be in anyone's debt!
A Visit from Sir Voland
A man of wealth and taste introduced himself to at my court today.  He has heard of my studies and offered to teach me the secrets of nature and magic at his school in the mountains.
I shall gain the knowledge of the arcane.
I do not trust this man.
Magical Studies
My studies at Scholomance have begun to pay off.  In learning secrets hidden from mortal men, I realize how little what I've learned before truly meant.
This is the path of magic.
Magic is not for me.
Religious Authorities Angered

It has come to my attention that not only have you begun the study of witchcraft, but are in direct tutelage under the devil himself.  For the sake of your soul, abandon this blasphemy and [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName]'s teachings.

It has come to my attention that your recent studies in magic have not been under proper [Root.Religion.GetName] tradition, but instead under the false instruction of a foreign god.  Leave that place and seek proper instruction, or you may risk the wrath of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]
Who cares what fool think about me.
How could I have strayed so far?
Excommunication!
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has refused to give up their profane studies.  There is now only one course of action.
They are no longer part of [From.Religion.GetName] faith.
Excommunication
A letter arrived today from the [From.GetTitle].  It seems that your refusal has angered [From.GetHerHim] and you've been excommunicated.
Oh.
Advanced Studies

Your teacher has been pleased with your progress, and feels it is time for more advanced studies.  He can teach you mysteries beyond [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName] and the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith.
I will follow your teachings
I think I will hold on to my faith
A Final Chance
Your teacher was not happy with your last response.  Although it would be a lot of wasted potential, if you aren't prepared for the greater mysteries of the universe, you should just leave.
I will follow your teachings
I'll go my own way, then
Magical Studies
With your increasing study and devotion to your new teachings, you feel much closer to understanding the secret mysteries of the universe
Eternity

Your teaches has come to you with a fascinating opportunity.  The bodies of the living are weak, and the stress of magic can be deadly for those who are not prepared.  To avoid this fate, he can teach you ways to live on through death, empowered by the blood of others.
Blood alone moves the wheels of history
I'll take my chances with mortality
But I already am immortal
Graduation
You have completed your training and are ready to face and dominate the universe on your own.  Of course, the doors of Scholomance will always be open to you.
The world is strange, but I am ready
I'll have to find more knowledge elsewhere, then.
Wild Man
While on your hunt, a wild, unkempt man leaped upon you.  You quickly managed to shove him off, but not before he managed to bite you.
I don't feel very well. Let's head back, and bring him with us.
How dare he attack the [Root.GetTitle]!
Transformation
As the disease wracks your body, the full moon approaches.  You feel your muscles strengthen and your hair grow long.  Your body twists into a new form...
This isn't rabies...
Wild Man in Woods
A group of peasants came to my throne room complaining of a wild man running about in the woods.  They claim he was a werewolf and has been killing their villages.
I will hunt down and kill this wild man for them.
Arrange a hunt – he can't kill anyone from the dungeon.
The realm can't really afford this.
The Wolf Child
A group of peasants dragged a small child to my court today.  They claim this abandoned child is cursed and will turn into a murderous wolf when he comes of age.
One child isn't worth the safety of an entire city.  Kill him.
Your court is outraged that you would kill a child.
There's nothing we can do. Leave the child in the woods.
Your court is upset that you would abandon a child.
I will take care of this child myself.  He will grow up fine.
I have been praying for a child.  Perhaps this is the answer.
Specialization
The universe is an expansive place, and what lies beyond is even more so.  I will need to focus my studies on a specific field
I will call beings from other lands and bind them to my will
I will learn to bewitch people's minds
I will learn the secret to turn metals into gold
I will look close to earth and study the secrets of plants
Your understanding of the secrets of the universe has increased.
Recent events have increased your knowledge of the magical arts.
After all of done, what I'm capable of is an amazement to all.  I have ample reason to be proud.
With everything my magic can do, I feel like there's nothing I can't accomplish.  I just need to set my mind to it.
There's so much work to be done.  Romance is just a waste of time that I don't have.
In magic, I need precision – I can afford to skip any steps or slack off.  The same applies in life.
The church is right that there's more to the universe than mortal eyes can see, but I've learned more in a week than they find in a lifetime.
With all the constant studying for my magic, it's no surprise that I began to branch out and research even more subjects.
As I was about to round the corner, I caught a glimpse of my rival, [From.GetTitledFirstName], heading toward me with and angry look about [From.GetHerHim]
I'll use my magic to hide!
Try to use magic to avoid the encounter
Magic can turn the tables
Use your magic to embarrass [From.GetFirstName]
As [FromFrom.GetSheHe] came around the corner, I turned myself invisible and [FromFrom.GetSheHe] walked right past me.
Before [FromFrom.GetSheHe] get there, I slid into an alcove and created an illusion of a wall.  [FromFrom.GetSheHeCap] did notice anything odd.
Right before [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] got to the corner, I touched [FromFrom.GetHerHis] mind with my magic.  [FromFrom.GetSheHeCap] then muttered about having forgot something and turned back.
That's a relief.
As [FromFrom.GetSheHe] came towards me, I tried to turn invisible.  Unfortunately, it didn't work and I was just foolishly pressed against the wall.
I hid in a small nook behind some armor and tried to create an illusionary wall, but just pushed over the armor and created a huge mess
I tried to alter [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s mind, but just managed to run right into [FromFrom.GetHerHim]
I'm never going to live this down.
I reached out and addled the mind of [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]. [FromFrom.GetSheHeCap] promptly stumbled into the throne room in a stupor and everyone thought [FromFrom.GetSheHe] was drunk.
Now that's entertainment!
Several courtiers are upset by [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s behavior.
As I tried to perform a magical ritual, I got caught in my clothes and fell through the doors and into the throne room, startling everyone.
So much for people's opinion of me.

As I walked around a corner in the court, I saw [From.GetTitledFirstName] muttering to [From.GetHerselfHimself].  I began to feel dizzy, the fell into a crowded room in a stupor.  I couldn't recover my senses, and now they all think I'm drunk
Somehow this is [From.GetFirstName]'s fault, I know it!
All my life, I have been telling the [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle]s that my powers are a gift from [Root.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap]. Fortunately, I think they have begun to agree.
I am performing miracles
All of the credit belongs to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap].

As I dug through every library I could find, I came across a collection of books by Hermes Trismegistus.  The Hermetic Corpus is one of the greatest works on alchemy, magic, and astrology.  Fortunately, the owner was willing to part with them, for a small fee.
I'll start reading them right away
It's not worth the cost
After years combing over everything in the Books of Hermes, I have feel I have finally mastered their teachings.
A long read, but a rewarding one.
The Books of Hermes
Researching into the author of these books, I have discovered that Hermes Trismegistus is actually the prophet Idris and one of the ancestors of the prophet Muhammad
Reading over the Hermetic works, I see the truth of Alchemy - it is not just the mere changing of lead to gold, but an investigation of the mysteries of birth, life, death, and resurrection
Through distillation, fermentation, and other processes, I can speed the course of nature.  This quickening process brings a natural body to perfection.
The wisdom of the universe is brought to us through the stars.  Their movements must be more than mere laws, but as symbols telling the mind of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap].
There are two kinds of magic: Goetia from [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodNameCap] and Theurgy from [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]. The latter is the key to the purification needed for Alchemy.
While reason can bring good or ill depending on where ones perceptions come. Truth lies with bringing positive change.
In the beginning, the world was created from primary matter. From this, the elements were made.  By returning to this, perhaps they can be remade.
I keep learning more from these books.
Reading has brought a new revelation: It is a ridiculous thing to confess the World to be one, one Sun, one Moon, one Divinity, and yet to have, I know not how many gods.  There is only one god...
And Jesus is his son.
And Muhammad is his prophet.
Expressed through the Amesha Spentas
I must forget these thoughts – all of the gods deserve worship.
I've been having trouble with my studies and feel I should look further abroad.  In Christian lands, a monk is said to have created a bronze head that can answer any question...

I've been having trouble with my studies and feel I should look further abroad.  In the Muslim study of “Al-Kimiya,” they have eight elements: Æther, air, earth, fire, water, sulfur, salt, and mercury...
Perhaps these foreigners are on to something.
What would heathens know?
The Elements
Everything in the universe reflects four competing natures: hotness against coldness, and dryness against moisture.  By altering these natures, an object itself can be altered or controlled.

Everything is made of five elements, reflecting the five senses. Earth can be perceived with all sense. Water has no odor, but is felt by the other four. Fire can be heard, felt, and seen. Air can only be heard and felt. The void is beyond all senses but hearing.

The world is made of five elements.  The first four are seen every day: earth, fire, water, and wind.  The quintessense, æther, is is incorruptable an unchanging.  These all come from the original element, Prima Materia, from which all things can be accomplished
The universe can be controlled.
After lots of learning and preparation, I am prepared to try and transmute base metals into the noble gold.
I'll need some special tool. And lots of lead.
I don't think I'm ready yet.
I have my alchemical tools set and a supply of materials at the ready.  Now how to actually start the transmutation...
Treat the metal with some powder of the philosopher's stone
Such a powerful item should guarantee success
Patinate it with sulfur and alloy with nickle to increase the negredo and albedo
Work the four phases created by Miriam the Prophetess
I need to heat it to near melting to increase its elemental hotness
Adjust the properties from the writings of Jabir ibn Hayyan
I will take the metal with me and begin ritually purifying myself.
As above, so below.  My purity and nobility will improve the metal.
Dissolve it with Oil of Vitriol to increase its elemental wetness
The first stage is complete, but the process will take more than that.  How will I proceed?
Speak a litany of names of the divine and profane over it from the Lesser Key of Solomon
Using secret alchemical knowledge has a great chance of success.
Smelt the metal with dragonfire
Power beyond the reach of most mortals is sure to work.
Inscribe it with TIPHARAH in gold
Transmute it with secret knowledge from Jewish mysticism
Bathe it in an admixture of sulfur, salt, and mercury
Use knowledge of the middle eastern elements
Alloy it with bronze and with copper to increase its citrinitas and rubido
Burn incense in a holy lamp and spread it with an almond branch
Use the secrets from the Book of Abramelin
Cleanse myself, then magically bind an angel to the metals.
Use magic to reflect your own purity
Failure! After all my hard work, all I have to show for it is a pile of melted lead.
Here's to learning from your mistakes, I hope.
Chrysopoeia
Success! I have managed to turn normal metals like lead or iron into gold!  Not I just need to purify out the remaining non-gold elements
Aqua Regia can dissolve any metal.
Aqua Fortis should clear out most of the poor metals
I shall use Mercury to spread the transmutation and convert those metals too
Try to spread the transmutation. Success based on magic education.
I shall use prayer and meditation to spread the gold's nobility to the lower metals
Try to spread the transmutation. Success based on religious education and right living.
While it's true that Aqua Regia dissolves everything, I forgot to account for the fact that this included the gold itself.
Wait! I can reconstitute it and try again.  I'll only lose some time.
The Aqua Fortis removed most of the other metals.  It's low quality gold, but I've created gold nevertheless.
I am an alchemist.
The gold is nice, I guess.
My work failed.  The gold has turned back into the original metals.
Still, I've made gold and I can do it again
That was a waste of time.
Success after success!  All of the metal is now pure, noble gold!
This is alchemy.
I'm rich!
At first, I thought the transmutation was a success, but when I checked more thoroughly, I found that only the outer layer was gold – the inside was pyrite.
What a waste.
Oil of Vitriol should remove the base metals, letting me keep the gold.
No one will know unless I tell them.
With my practice and the skill of my magic, it is time for my Magnum Opus – the creation of Alkahest, the universal solvent.
The ultimate solvent from the ultimate power of the Lapis Philosophorum
Heating gold dissolved in aqua regia creates dragon's blood crystals... perhaps real dragon's blood is the key.
Blood is the root of power. My blood shall be the key ingredient
Perhaps if I acquire some Aqua Regia...
Caustic Lime... Alcohol... Carbonate of potash...
Bah! Spit is the universal solvent.
Success... in a manner of speaking.  I've managed to create the universal solvent, but can't find anything to store it in that it can't eat through.
It truly is universal.
Then what's the point?
While my creations have been able to dissolve, melt, and decompose a great many things, none are worthy of being called “universal”
Perhaps it's time for a break.
One of the great goals of alchemy is to create a universal solvent.  For practice, I should try to create the closest thing we have – Aqua Regia
I will need niter, alum, blue vitriol, and acidum salis.
That won't make gold, so I'm not spending gold.
I've managed to create Aqua Regia.  I don't have much use for it at the moment, and it loses potency quickly, but merely having done it was educational.
Money well spent.
Though I've spent time pursuing a single magical focus, I've been having doubts that this is really the path for me.
Yes, I should persue another path.
No, I'll stick with it a bit longer.

From my research, one of the earliest steps in transmuting metal to gold involves yellowing the metal.  Today it stuck me: what if I use something that's already yellow? I'll skip a step! I've got plenty of straw in the stables, and... Look! A spinning wheel!
I shall spin straw into gold!
I've spun and spun and lookie what I got! It's gold!
That was easier than I thought.
I've spun and spun and lookie what I got!
I've spun straw into... spun straw!
Almost as important to defense as the size of our army is how big the enemy thinks our army is.  I can create illusions that we have more troops than we do.
I shall enchant my capital at [Root.Capital.GetName].
I need to focus on [crown_focus.GetName].
Perhaps [random_province.GetName].
Our garrisons are just fine.
One of the simpler and more useful tricks in magic is the art of shapeshifting.  It can get you out of a tight spot and is a great tool for spying.
Perhaps a cat or a dog.
Why would a dragon want to be anything else?
Shapeshifting isn't anything special
Human is fine.
As I've gotten more experienced in magic, I've begun to experiment in controlling the weather. I think I could now use this to improve the crop growth in the surrounding area
I'll get the most from my capital, [Root.Capital.GetName].
I've been working on economic growth in [crown_focus.GetName].
[random_province.GetName] could use some rain.
Or I could just make sure I get some nice sunny days at the palace.
Wandering around as a small animal has been a great opportunity. I've been able to hear much that people won't say while they know I'm around
Is that really what you think of me?
I've found out that [From.GetTitledFirstName], my [GetFromRelation], has taken ill.  I am concerned for [From.GetHerHis] health and I wonder if my herbal knowledge could help.
I will brew up a potion.
Offer a potion to improve [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s health.
