[From.GetSheHeCap] doesn't need my help.
After hearing of my illness, my [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName], has brought me a potion that [From.GetSheHe] brewed, which [From.GetSheHe] says should ease my illness.
Bottom's up.
I'll stick with what my physician recommends.
After taking [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s potion, I feel alive again, like I wasn't ill at all.
That was an great potion.
[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] was right. After taking [FromFrom.GetHerHis] potion, I do feel much better.
That was a good potion.
I took [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s potion, but nothing seems to have happened.
[FromFrom.GetSheHe]'s wasting my time.
After drinking [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s potion, I feel even worse than before.
I won't be drinking another of [FromFrom.GetHerHis] potions in the future.
[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s potion didn't do me any favors.  It's almost worse than the disease itself.
Next time just hand me poison and be done with it.
I tried to give [From.GetTitledName] to take the potion, but [From.GetSheHe] just wouldn't accept it.
Doesn't [From.GetSheHe] trust me?
My potion worked! After [From.GetTitledFirstName] took it, [From.GetSheHe] started feeling much better.
I'm glad I could help my [GetFromRelation]
[From.GetTitledFirstName] was eager to take my potion, but after drinking it, nothing happened.
Did I make a mistake somewhere?
After [From.GetTitledName] took my potion, [GetSheHe] almost immediately doubled over in pain. I think my potion made things worse.
Everyone realizes this was an accident, right?
Magnum Opus

With everything I have learned, it's time for me to begin my Magnum Opus.  The creation of the Philosopher's Stone.  The thinking man's dream, able to turn lead into gold, salve to any ill, and able to grant life eternal.
Eternity awaits
It's just a fairy tale.
The Preparation of Earth

To begin, I must collect each of the elements and bring them to an excited and awakened state.  To do this, I need that element in an energetic state, beyond its existence in the mundane world.  I shall start with Earth.
I will gather soil from holy ground.
Has the potential for a great deal of progression toward creating the stone, but will upset your [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle]s.
I shall use the soil from my noble estate
Chance of success is more likely the higher your noble rank
Take dirt from a well-travelled pathway to bring the experience of its travellers.
Has a moderate chance of success
The Preparation of Air
With the Earth ready, the next step is Wind.  While difficult to store, what I've learned should keep its power while contained.
I shall ask Aeolus of Hippotes, the lord of the four winds.
Success requires the favor of the gods, especially his father, Poseidon.
I will gather the winds at the top of a tall mountain
Has a high chance of success.
I will gather the winds during a fierce storm
Has a medium chance of success. It may take a long time to wait for a good storm.
There is air all around me right now.
Has a low chance of success. You won't have to wait very long.
The Preparation of Water
I have prepared Earth and Air.  Next is water, fluid and changing to suit its environment, just as the Philosopher's Stone itself can change the form of another.
The seven seas all connect. By taking water from one ocean, I take from all.
High chance of success.
I shall take water from a sacred pool.
I shall take water from the mighty river that flows through my lands.
Medium chance of success.
I will use water drawn from the well.
Low chance of success
The Preparation of Fire

With Earth, Wind, and Water at the ready, one core element remains: Fire. It offers light and warmth, driving out the cold, yet also pain and death for those who draw too close.  Now I must reach out and grab it at its hottest.
Nothing burns hotter than dragonfire.
Has the possibility of great progress.
My own essence is that of smokeless fire.
Guarantees progress
The blood of dragons flows through my veins – the very essence of fire.
I shall take sacred fire from the temple.
High chance of success, but will upset the [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle]s.
I shall build a fire right away
Low chance of success
The Preparation of Æther
With the four core elements prepared, there is still one remaining, the most elusive element, and the core the the creation of Prima Materia – Æther.
Magic flows through my veins.  My blood will provide the element.
Guarantees progress, possibly more than normal.
I will infuse it with magic myself.
Success based off magical skill
I will hire the greatest mage in the land
Medium chance of success. Your magical skill doesn't improve your chances.
I will hire a local witch.
Low chance of success. Your magical skill doesn't improve your chances.
The Binding of Anima Mundi

With all of the elements gathered, there is only last last step until I see the fruits of my labors.  I must bind the elements with Anima Mundi, the connection between all living things.  Then, they should fuse into the Prima Materia and form the Philosopher's Stone.
My blood has mixed with that of countless others
High chance of success, and maybe a bit more.
It was written that the name of Shiva is an alchemical vehicle
Pray to Shiva.  High chance of success.
It will be bound by life.  I will sacrifice one of my prisoners.
Medium chance of success.
Love is what binds us all together
Low chance of success
The Philosopher's Stone
All of this work has paid off. The elements have been bound together into the original matter and formed the Philosopher's Stone.
My work is complete.
Prima Materia Observed
The elements bound together and I saw the true prima materia, but it was unstable.  It collapsed and destroyed much of my lab.  I don't have a Philospher's Stone, but I know I'm close.
I'll keep trying until I succeed
I've wasted all of this time.
Base Matter
There was no reaction. Nothing changed forms or brought in any new effect.  It's just a lump of hot, wet dirt.
At least I learned a lot along the way.
Because of my injury, I have trouble making the precise movements required for my magic and my spells have been failing at important time.
Because of my speech impediment, I have been trouble speaking the words of power and divine names I need to cast my spells.
There is no end to my frustration.
I have grown increasingly frustrated with my disability and I've decided to do something about it.  I have heard rumors of a mystical spring which can heal any wound and plan to seek it out.
It will be a long journey, but it will be worth it.
And then perhaps look for fairies or some other waste of time.
After a long time in the wild, I found the spring.  As I bathed myself in it, I fell asleep, but when I awoke, all of my injuries were healed.
It's a miracle!
No matter how much I try, I just can't wrap my head around any of this. Why does magic have to be so hard?
It's too hard for me.
The Search for Azoth

As I see illness and suffering around me, I can't help but think my alchemy may have a solution.  I have heard rumors of the legendary Azoth, the first outflowing of life, recreated, and able to cure all ills.
I will find a way to make this Azoth
I don't have time to chase fairy tales.
Dead End Research
While I have dedicated all of my free time to searching for the recipe for Azoth, all my leads have come up empty
This has all been a waste of time.
Research Complete
My research is complete.  After getting past many false leads and rumors, I've discovered that I will need sulfur, mercury, and salt.
I can buy those at any market.
I can't afford this.
Preparation
I have all the ingredients I need. Unfortunately, the recipe didn't say how they were to be combined. I doubt I can just thrown them all together and stir.
I'll imbue my health directly into it. Health for healing.
It's a risk, but very likely to work.
I should add a bit of blood to the mix.
Suffer bloodloss, but have a high chance of success.
Prayer and meditation. As above, so below.
Success depends on a life of virtue.
Just throw them all together and stir.
Not very likely to work.
The mixture didn't work.  I only ended up with a pile of mush.
At least I learned a lot along the way.
The experiment was a success!  I no longer need to fear illness.
I have discovered Azoth
The Search for Panacea
As I see illness all around me, I can't help but remember tales of a medicine that can cure all ills, called Panacea.  I wonder if I may be able to find and prepare it.
I'll research what I can.
This isn't the time for flights of fancy.
Rumors Don't Pan Out
I followed every lead I could, but I'm no closer to finding the Panacea than I was when I started.
It's time to give up.
Foreign Herbs
I have traced back information to a Tartarian herb the Romans called Panax – it is said that the locals used in as their primary medicine, with little need for anything else.
Some merchant must it – I'll pay any price.
It's time for a trip to Tartaria.
It's not worth the time or money.
Miasma
I have prepared the herbs, but there is one remaining concern – in their native form, the plant exudes some miasma, making harm rather than heal
Mix in medicines that fight the misasma.
High success depending on your learning
Mix in foreign tree saps traditionally added in the region
Decent chance of success
Store it with spices and flowers to clear up the miasma.
Low chance of success
My plan didn't work – the herbs emit a putrid, sickening cloud and odor.  Taking this will only make disease worse.
I'll need to dispose of this very carefully.
I've done it! This medicine should cure any illness and ease the pain of anyone who takes it.  This is the power of the Panacea
I'll hold on to it until the right time.
The Wizard's Tower

Over time, you've begun to feel that your efforts for magic are restricted in your palace. Libraries of mundane books and dining halls just don't fit your needs.  Perhaps it's time to build a tower dedicated to your craft.
I will hire the best architect in the land
Sent word to locate a skilled architect to design your tower.
I'll make do with what I have.
I will hire a skilled local builder
Hire a local to design your tower.
I will design it myself
Use your learning and knowledge of architecture to design the tower.
Now that I have the materials coming in, I will need to find someone to actually build the tower.
I will enchant the building materials to assemble themselves
This enchantment will take some time to complete
I will summon laborers from the lower realms
Summon a horde of demons to perform your labors.
Hire local workers
Hire workers from nearby towns and cities.
Collect prisoners from neighboring towns
Use prisoners for labor.
Plans for the tower are underway, but I should get a head start on gathering materials for the construction.
I will use my magic to gather materials from other worlds.
Summon materials through magic.
I will transmute waste materials into quality materials.
The alchemy will take some time but give high quality.
A tower for herbs should be made of wood
Materials are cheap, but low quality.
Import the stone
Get high quality stone at a cost.
We'll build a quarry
Create a stone quarry in your capital
Destroy peasant buildings for materials
Loot materials and money, but upset the owners.
Construction is starting, but I'm considering a last minute change to my plans for some extra utility.
I can make a scrying room to spy on my enemies
This room is expensive but will help detect plots.
I'll create a room of portals to bring troops en mass.
Adding this room will extend construction time.
I will turn the entire tower in to gold
Transmuting the tower will take a long time, but improve prestige.
A greenhouse full of rare plants would help
Will improve local supply limits
We should stick with the existing plans
Between labor shortages and material issues, there have been numerous delays in the tower's construction.
Ignore the issues and rush the construction
Construction will finish faster, but this may cause issues down the line.
Give them all the time they need
Construction will take longer, but it will be done right.
Give them a little more time
Construction is delayed slightly.
Construction has reached the point where I can finally start moving all of my equipment into the tower, but perhaps this can be an opportunity for some upgrades.
I'll have new equipment send to the tower.
May improve the quality of the tower
What I have now is fine.
Between labor, material, and land costs and everything happened outside of construction, the tower is costing more than originally expected.
But... my money!
With the tower close to completion, this is my last chance for any minor changes or additions to it.
I will weave calming enchantments into the tower.
Casting the enchantment will delay completion of the tower, but reduce the chance of revolts.
I will bind in guards from another realm
Prepare a retinue from another world
I will need a large dedicated lab to transmuting large amounts of gold.
This will be costly, but gain more gold in the long run
I will stock it with prepared medical supplies
Medical supplies will help recover from illnesses
Stick to the plan.
My foreman just informed me that the tower has been completed, and to top it off, there's spare gold in the budget left over.
Let's go take a look!
My foreman just informed me that the tower has been completed, and to top it off, there are spare materials that can be used for other projects.
The tower is close to completion, but the last materials have been delayed.  The foreman tells me it could take another month for them to arrive.
Just... a... little... longer.
Finally my tower is complete.  Reaching high above the castle walls, it oversees the land, a massive testament to the power hiding within.
At last, it's done.
The tower in the old capital too far away for me to use and isn't doing anyone any good.
Destroy it and take anything valuable left over.
The old tower will be destroyed
On second thought, it's not hurting anything.
This old tower has a lot of potential, but the entire setup isn't really suited for my plans.  I'll need to get some people to move everything to fit my needs first.
Reconstruction is starting, but I'm considering a last minute change to my plans for some extra utility.
The renovation of the old tower is complete.  At last, a proper place to work my magic!
While collecting herbs in the forest, I came across some new plant I haven't seen before.  There's the possibility it could be useful to some medicine or potion.
Eat a bit of it.
You fall ill
If it was useful, I'd already know about it.
With the war against [non_roman_war_side.GetBaseName] beginning, we should perform an Anaklesis.  If we can draw the favor of the foreign gods to our side, victory is assured.
With the war against [non_roman_war_side.GetBaseName] beginning, we should perform an Evocatio.  If we can draw the favor of the foreign gods to our side, victory is assured.
We shall build a new temple for one of their gods.
We shall make a sacrifice to their gods.
I have no time for this – we must prepare for battle.
The foreign gods favor [Root.GetTitledFirstName].
The foreign gods remain with [non_roman_war_side.GetTitledFirstName].
Since completing the ritual, the [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle]s have been watching the signs, and it is very clear that we are favored by the foreign [non_roman_war_side.Religion.GetRandomGodName].
Their god abandons them. Victory will be ours.

Since completing the ritual, the [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle]s have been watching the signs. Unfortunately, it seem that their [non_roman_war_side.Religion.GetHighGodName] still favors their faithful.
Then this will be settled by strength of arms.

Scouts have reported that the [From.GetBaseName] have been performing a strange ritual.  My [Root.GetLordSpiritualName] reports that [From.Religion.GetHighGodName] appears to favor the attackers as punishment for our sins.
[From.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap] has abandoned us!

Scouts have reported that the [From.GetBaseName] have been performing a strange ritual and My [Root.GetLordSpiritualName] believes that they were trying to convince [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] to abandon us.  However, we have not been abandoned in our time of need.
If [Root.GetHighGodName] if for us, who shall be against us?

I have heard rumors spread around of a grimoire written by King Solomon the Wise of Jerusalem.  It details experiments used to summon and constrain spirits of the dead and demons to gain magical powers.
Finding this is worth any cost
Send people to search for the book.
If it's so great, why haven't I heard of it?

The men I had sent out to search for the Key of Solomon have slowly been returning.  Unfortunately, they haven't found anything of substance.  Still, the world is a large place – it may still be out there.
We need to keep looking.
The search for the Greater Key of Solomon will continue.
Perhaps it's time to give up.

It's been discovered that [kos_vassal.GetTitledFirstName] has a copy of the Key in his personal library.  [kos_vassal.GetSheHeCap] doesn't seem to know it's value other than that I want it, and will give it to me... but I'll owe [kos_vassal.GetHerHim] a favor.
It's a deal!
I don't trust [kos_vassal.GetFirstName] enough to owe [kos_vassal.GetHerHim] a favor.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] came to me looking for some foreign books I had in my library.  They were useless to me, but in [From.GetHerHis] desperation, [From.GetSheHe] mentioned owning me a favor...
Well, that was easy.
I've discovered that a foreign merchant has come across a copy of the Key of Solomon.  Merchants being what they are, he is willing to part with it for a price.
A hefty sum, but worth it.
I'm not sure it's worth the cost.

After some searching, it's been discovered that a copy of the key is held by none other than my bastard, [kos_vassal.GetFirstName].  [kos_vassal.GetSheHeCap] doesn't know its value other than that I want it, but it demanding to be legitimized in exchange for it.
It's a deal.
I'll not let them sully my family name!
My [GetFromRelation] came me trying to get a book from my collection.  I managed to talk them into legitimizing my claim in exchange
As is my right.
A copy of the key was found in a nearby church's reliquary.  They clearly aren't willing to just hand it over, but they won't be able to do much if I press the issue.
Send troops to seize it.
I won't make an enemy of the church.

I have discovered that my liege has come across a copy of the key.  Unfortunately, in exchange, [Root.Liege.GetSheHe] is demanding that I convert to [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] religion and become [Root.Liege.Religion.GetName].
If it gets what I need.
I will never abandon [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]!

It's been said that the Babylonian philospher Iohé Grevis, under the command of an angel, placed a spell on the Key of Solomon so that no one unworth, unwise, or unbelieving could read it.  I never thought that would include me, and yet the contents are mere gibberish.
Have I come this far for nothing?
While it seemed complicated at first, as I've worked on it I have found that the arcane formulas and mystic experiments have become easier and clearer.
I'm getting better!
There have been cruel whispers throughout the court about me.  They say that being a seiðmenn, a male sorceror, is weak and that I am unmanly for practicing magic.
Cursing them would only prove them right, wouldn't it?
Seeking greater magical power, I have come across information related to a grimoire known as the Lesser Key of Solomon.  If it are the names of seventy-two demons and instructions on summoning them.
I should try and find a copy.
Begin the search for the Lesser Key of Solomon
No good comes of consorting with demons
I have found a merchant passing through who has a [Root.Culture.GetName] translation of the Lesser Key of Solomon, which he is willing to sell me.
Trading gold for power? That's a good deal.
The cost is far too high.

I was informed that the book was found in an old library, but when I arrived, I saw it in the hands of a demon in the form of an old man riding a crocodile.  He was willing to give me the book as a trade.  He said he had no interest in my soul, as I was heading to his realm anyway, but instead merely demanded my supplication.
Bow before the demon
I will make no deals with a demon.

Your quest has lead you to a ruined castle, mostly destroyed by raided some time ago, but not completely empty.  Inside dwells a large beast with the head of a snake, the body of a leopard, and the haunches of a lion.
That beast will be no problem for me.
Perhaps I can find the book elsewhere...
I have found that the book I seek is in the home of a heathen witch.  I'm fairly certain I could sneak in and steal it without her noticing.
This will be easy,
You are caught by the witch.
Stealing is wrong.
Disaster! As I was grabbing the book, I lost all consciousness.  I woke up at home but I feel as if a foul curse has been placed upon me.
How bad could the curse be?
The book is finally in my hand, yet that doesn't feel like enough.  I need to test it.  I need to summon one of its demons.
I shall summon Barbatos, the Bearded Duke
The demon Barbatos appears in your court.
Duke Berith, Goldmaker, I summon thee!
The demon Berith appears in your court.
Eligos, Great Duke of Sixty Legions, heed me!
The demon Eligos appears in your court.
No, just having the book is enough for me.
I've learned quite a bit about alchemy as I've gone and I am thinking of publishing my notes for others to learn from.
I'll turn knowledge into gold
My notes are nothing special
My book has been highly requested at court, and I've sold many copies. It seems to be the item on everyone's lips.
Alchemy can indeed make gold.
My book has been the talk of the court, but not in the way I had hoped. It's been a subject of mockery, with learned men describing it as childish and ill-informed.
I never should have published them.
My writing has made its way to the church, who have been very critical of it.  They claim the writings in it are contrary to [Root.Religion.GetName] canon and declared it heretical.
This isn't the reputation I had hoped for.
Dragon Angers Locals

Some local human peasants have come to you complaining that you've been flying around eating their farm animals and burning their lands. You try to explain that no dragon could be expected not to do these things, but they don't seem convinced.
Pay them off.
Ignore them.
Assure them that you'll try to be more prudent in the future.
Pathetic peasants! Devour their souls!
Small Hoard
You've noticed that your hoard of wealth is meager even by human standards, and this ill-befits a dragon such as yourself.
Exact a special tax on your vassals.
Reevaluate your realm's expenses.
Accept your poverty for now.
You Grow Stronger
As a dragon, the long decades do not wear away at you, but instead make you healthier, and your long experience ruling shows over younger peers. You awaken today feeling wiser than ever before.
Excellent.
As your horde grows, so to do does the reputation that comes with it.  Tales of your wealth reach the farthest corners of the land
As well they should.
As you rest upon your mountainous horde, you can practically feel the gold strengthening your soul.  Surely this is why dragons are the world's masters.
And I'll use this strength to get more gold.
As my troops ransacked [From.GetBestName]'s treasure room, they managed to grab an interesting artifact that [From.GetSheHe] was hiding.

Now that you have come in to your inheritance, you have found that [FromFrom.GetBestName], was paying tribute to a nearby dragon, [dragon_suzerain.GetFirstName].  You've also received an ultimatum from the dragon – either continue this arrangement, or have your realm burnt to the ground.
I guess we have no choice.
We can pay in one lump sum, then stay free.
It's cheaper just to swear fealty
If [dragon_suzerain.GetSheHe] wants it, [dragon_suzerain.GetSheHe] will have to come take it.
After the death of [FromFromFrom.GetBestName], [FromFromFrom.GetHerHis] heir, [From.GetBestName] has agreed to continue paying tribute.
Good, that saves time.
After the death of [FromFromFrom.GetBestName], [FromFromFrom.GetHerHis] heir, [From.GetBestName] has offered a large sum of money to avoid paying future tribute.
I'll leave [From.GetHerHim] be... for now.
[From.GetBestName] stops paying tribute.
After the death of [FromFromFrom.GetBestName], [FromFromFrom.GetHerHis] heir, [From.GetBestName] has offered to become my vassal rather than paying tribute in gold.
I still get what I want.
After the death of [FromFromFrom.GetBestName], [FromFromFrom.GetHerHis] heir, [From.GetBestName] has rallied [From.GetHerHis] armies to try and stop paying me.
I'll put them in their place.

We will not stand idly by and allow the realm to fall our of draconic control.  Your human heir is a disgrace and will bring ruin upon us.  The has come for you to name a new heir in their place..  Submit peacefully to this demand or face the consequences

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
Under the pressure from draconic hardliners, [From.GetTitledName] has agreed to make [FromFrom.GetBestName] [From.GetHerHis] heir.

Rather than risking civil war tearing the realm apart, I have decided to give in to your demand and name you my heir.  But this treacherous act of blackmail will not be forgotten...

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

Rather than letting civil war tear the realm apart, [From.GetTitledName] has agreed to declare me [From.GetHerHis] heir. Your valuable support in this conflict will not be forgotten.

Sincerely,
[FromFrom.GetTitledName]

I've been receiving more and more reports from my vassals of peasants and merchants worried about their safety with the almost constant arrival of dragons performing heathen rituals in [upset_province.GetName].  They are demanding that I find some way to stop them for coming.

The [Root.Religion.GetPriestName]s from [upset_province.GetName] keep complaining to me about having a major heathen site right under their noses and demanding that I find a way to destroy it. It wouldn't be so bad if this “eternal flame” wasn't seemingly indestructable.
Does it look like I haven't tried?

[upset_vassal.GetTitledFirstName] came up to me today and insisted that I wasn't doing everything I could to stop the heathen rituals in [upset_province.GetName], saying that I was sinful and impious.
If [upset_vassal.GetSheHe] thinks [upset_vassal.GetSheHe] could do better, then [upset_vassal.GetSheHe] should do it!

I've been hearing rumours that, after a visit to [upset_province.GetName], my courtier [converted_courtier.GetFirstName], once a good [converted_courtier.Religion.GetName], has instead embraced the religion of the dragons.
That can't be true, can it?
People have been talking about a popular draconic preacher who has shown up in [upset_province.GetName], leading people away from the true [Root.Religion.GetName] faith.
He's too popular to do anything overt.
Arrest him and execute him.

As the sickness spreads in [upset_province.GetName], rumors have run wild, claiming that the disease is caused by the profane rituals performed by the draconic pilgrims.  The locals are demanding that I destroy their ritual site to stop the illness.
It's not that easy...

Vicious rumors have begun to take root throughout the realm – people throughout my court are claiming that the reason I haven't destroyed the heathen ritual site in [upset_province.GetName] is that I'm secretly leading their unholy rites.
That's preposterous!

Several of the [Root.Religion.GetPriestName]s have been complaining of constant conflicts between the local [upset_province.Religion.GetName]s an the draconic pilgrims and are demanding that I do something about it.
Easy. The locals will need to convert, or they die.
If the [Root.Religion.GetPriestName]s have a problem, the [Root.Religion.GetPriestName]s can fix it.
We'll drive out the pilgrims, then.
I'll deliver a speech and smooth things over.

Rumors have begun to spread throughout [upset_province.GetName] that I am working to try and destroy the heathen's holy site, known as the “eternal flame” present there.  Guards have found peasants stockpiling arms and local preachers speak out against me.
They better not try anything.
I've gathered my council together to try and find a way to destroy this infernal flame the heathens keep worshiping and put a stop to the strife it brings our lands.
We won't stop until it's destroyed
Since I no longer directly control the county of [destroy_flame.GetName], the destruction of the flame there is no longer under my control.
I can only hope others continue in my stead.
While I was working on a way to destroy the heathen fire in [destroy_flame.GetName], I found that another had beaten me to it – the flame is gone.
My work is finished, then.
After a lot of hard work and dedication, we have finally managed to destroy the site of these foul heathen rituals.  No longer shall they bring evil upon our lands.
[Root.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap] be praised!
Despite the effort I've gone through, that evil flame still burns in [destroy_flame.GetName].
We have to keep searching
I need to focus my time and money elsewhere
Keep searching for a way to destroy it.
Stop searching.
You successfully destroy the flame
You fail to destroy the flame
You search for an alternate plan
Together, we have decided that we should try to bury this heather flame.  If the ground does not smother it, this should at least make it inaccessible.
Let's do it.
We should hire extra workers for this.
Spare no expense.
Let's try and think of a better plan.

The best way to stop a magical flame is with more magic.  I will can use my own talents to try to counter the spelling protecting this “eternal flame,” though it may test the limits of my magic, potentially burning them out if I strain too hard.
Let's give it a try.
You will be unable to cast spells for 1 year
I'll give this my all.
You will be unable to cast spells for 3 years
I'll succeed, no matter the cost!
It's not worth the risk.
My [Root.GetLordSpiritualName] has suggested that stopping the flame may be beyond my power, but not beyond [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName].  I should be spending my time in prayer and meditation.
Prayer is the answer.
More than that, I will take a vow of celibacy.
Perhaps something more hands-on would be better.
I will renounce wealth and take a vow of poverty.
My [Root.GetMarshalName] has proposed that we line up as much of our military force as possible and hit the heathen fire with a heavy seige bombardment until it's nothing but ruins.
Use what you have.
Dedicate some soldiers to it.
Dedicate the army to it.
There are better uses for our troops.
My [Root.GetTreasurerName] has suggested we try and flood the area that that profane flame occupies.  It may put out the flame, but it even it that fails, should cut off access to it.
It's a good plan.
Wall of the surrounding area to contain the water.
Use all the resources you need.
Sorry, I need that money elsewhere

In our search for the way to destroy this “eternal flame,” we have found an ancient ritual designed to extinguish them.  However, in order to complete it, I must sacrifice the life of someone closest to me.
I'm not going to sacrifice them.
I will sacrifice [child_sacrifice.GetFirstName].
I will sacrifice [spouse_sacrifice.GetFirstName].
I will sacrifice [lover_sacrifice.GetBestName].
I will sacrifice [friend_sacrifice.GetBestName].
If the dragons' rites will bring ruin to my lands, then perhaps their blood will bring ruin to their precious flame.
Round them up. Kill them all, and drown the flame in their blood.
Butchered my people
I think that's going a bit too far.
I now see how much of a fool I was to try and destroy the Eternal Flame.  I did not know how much I put the world at risk.
I now protect it from others like I was.
Sacrifice yourself to restore the flame

Although creating one of the Eternal Flames if beyond the powers of mortals, there are ancient rituals to reignite one that has been struck from the world.  Unfortunately, the rituals require a willing, noble dragon to sacrifice themself to become the new flame.
I will gladly sacrifice myself so the world may live.
On second thought...
A Flame Extinguished

Through the efforts of [From.GetBestName], the once mighty dragon's flame at [destroyed_flame.GetName] has been extinguished.  Once a pillar of faith to the pilgrims and pagan worshipers there, it burns no more.
That [GetFromRootInsult] will burn for this!
The old ways are gone.
I guess that flame wasn't so eternal after all.
Why should I care what one infidel does to another?
The Flame Reborn
With a great sacrifice, the [GetRootFromCompliment] dragon, [From.GetBestName] has turned [From.GetHerselfHimself] into a new Eternal Flame in [relit_flame.GetName].
Rejoice!
They still cling to their heathen traditions.

The Egyptians have many tombs in which they buried their ancestors. Tales say they buried many riches as well.
We must investigate.
We should not disturb these graves.
Expedition Lost
It has been weeks since the explorers set out to the tombs in search of wealth, but they have not returned.
We must have this treasure!
Perhaps it would be best to leave it be.
Expedition Success
Our explorers have returned, having plundered the Egyptian tombs and bringing with them as much gold as they could carry.
A worthwhile expedition.
Mummy Rising
The new explorers were never heard from again, and in their place the very dead that occupied the tombs have risen to fight back!
Disaster!
Rameses Reborn
After millenia of slumber, you have returned and taken back the kingdom that is rightfully yours.
As is only right.
You Grow Stronger
As an immortal, the long decades do not wear away at you, but instead make you healthier. You awaken today feeling wiser and stronger than ever before.
Excellent.
Spouse Turned
In the bedchamber last night, you seemed to regain the desire of your younger days. Some biting may have been involved.

You have founded an empire of immortals, and named yourself Archsire as first among them. Henceforth, the oldest of the vampires shall rule them all.

You've received a strange letter from [From.GetTitledFirstName] in which he claims to be an immortal and powerful vampire. Stranger still, the letter contains an offer to share this "gift!"
Why of course!
Politely decline.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has returned your offer along with vehement scorn and plans to expose you as a monster to the world!

As the blood of your victim slides through your throat, you feel power coursing through your veins. Old wounds heal, sinews strengthen, and what was once [From.GetBestName]'s is now yours.
The feeling of [From.GetBestName]'s blood sliding through my throat is exquisite.  I didn't want to stop, but I still let go before it was enough to kill [From.GetHerHim].

[From.GetTitledFirstName]'s blood was just what I needed.  Unfortunately, I become so lost in the taste that I wasn't paying attention to the door.  When someone walked in, I barely managed to escape, and they may have seen a glimpse of me.
[From.GetTitledFirstName]'s blood was just what I needed.  Unfortunately, [From.GetSheHe] started to come to while I was still feeding.  I ran away, but [From.GetSheHe] might suspect something.
I wasn't paying enough attention as I drained [From.GetBestName]'s blood, and was caught by a maid with my teeth still in [From.GetHerHis] now-lifeless throat.
I wasn't paying enough attention as I drained [From.GetBestName]'s blood, and a guard walked in before I could finish and tore me off [From.GetHerHim].
I am renewed!
It's only a suspicion...
I was careless.

As I walked through the hall, I felt a deep unease, as though some unhallowed figure was following me.  It was not long after that I was set upon by [From.GetBestName], who I thought my [GetFromRelation]!  As I threw [From.GetHerHim] off, I saw [From.GetHerHis] fangs and pallid skin and knew the truth.
