My nausea is gone, but no longer desire normal food, instead craving, as strange as it sounds, human blood.  The chest pains are gone but my heart's stopped entirely.  At last, all these strange symptoms seem clear.
I've become a vampire.
Tough Love
In the bedchamber last night, you found yourself so excited that your more bestial side may have emerged for a moment.
Oh, it's just a scratch.
Werewolf Limb Regeneration
Though your crippling injury might have been fatal for normal men, for one of the wolf, even the worst of wounds heal with time.
Much better.
Werewolf Eats Prisoner

Last night was a full moon, and though you tried to restrain yourself, you became the wolf again and broke free of your chambers. While you don't remember exactly what happened, you fear your court is a head smaller today.
Acknowledge your mistake and apologize.
Cover it up.
Blood of the Wolf
As you reach maturity, so too does the power in your blood. But is it the blood of a human or the blood of the wolf?
What does my future hold?
Werewolf Challenge

One of your subjects, an arrogant pup who thinks himself strong, has dared to challenge you in single combat for rule of the wolves. The duel is to the death, but refusing it would make you seem a coward.
Of course I must accept!
But I might actually lose...
Challenge Accepted
As expected, your liege has accepted your challenge. You will battle him in two weeks time.
He will die like the dog he is.
Challenge Refused
Your liege has refused your right to challenge him, dishonoring himself in the process.
That coward will pay for this!
Werewolf Challenge
The duel begins at sunset. You and your opponent shift forms as the moon rises over the night sky, both knowing that only one will see tomorrow.
Strike hard and fast.
Pause, and wait for your opponent to move.
Werewolf Challenge

Your opponent lunges at you quickly, and you move to deflect the strike. Too late, you realize that the attack was a feint, and you soon find sharp teeth in your neck. You are flung to the ground, bleeding badly and unable to retaliate any longer.
This is the end, then.
Werewolf Challenge
Your opponent lunges at you quickly but hastily. You deftly deflect the attack, and send him several paces behind you with his own momentum, giving you a chance to strike back.
Strike hard and fast.
Pause, and wait for your opponent to move.
Werewolf Challenge
Your opponent pauses in the combat, awaiting your move.
Take advantage of his hesitation.
Wait for him to strike first.
Werewolf Challenge
Your attack was successful! You tear out half of your opponent's throat in a lunge at his neck, and he now lies defeated and bleeding heavily beneath you.
Finish it.
Werewolf Challenge
Your opponent has defeated you utterly, and deals you the killing blow as you are helpless to resist.
It was a battle worthy of the greatest of warriors.
Offer of Lycanthropy

You've received a strange letter from [From.GetTitledFirstName] in which he claims to be an immortal and powerful werewolf (whatever that is). Stranger still, the letter contains an offer to share this "gift!"
Why of course!
Politely decline.
This is heresy!
Offer of Lycanthropy Accepted
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has returned your offer and gladly accepts it.
Excellent.
Offer of Lycanthropy Declined
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has returned your offer along with a regretful decline.
They don't know what they're missing.
Offer of Lycanthropy Declined 2
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has returned your offer along with vehement scorn and plans to expose you as a monster to the world!
Damn!
You Grow Stronger
As a werewolf, the long decades do not wear away at you, but instead make you healthier. You awaken today feeling wiser and stronger than ever before.
Excellent.
Assassination Plot
Perhaps I can take advantage of my secret to kill [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledName] without anyone recognizing me
He'll be attacked by a wolf while hunting.
Attacking personally puts the attacker at a slight risk of dying.
It's not worth risking exposure.
Wolf Attack
I had thought today was a good days to go hunting, but no sooner did I step foot in the forest that I was set upon by a vicious wolf
I can't get it off!
Looks like my quarry has come to me
Assassination Detected
[target_victim.GetTitledName] is dead, but not without incident.  A survivor saw me shapeshift.  Now everyone know I did it, and that I'm a werewolf.

[target_victim.GetTitledName] is dead, but not without incident.  A survivor saw [werewolf_attacker.GetTitledName] shapeshift.  Now everyone know I did it, and that [werewolf_attacker.GetSheHe]'s a werewolf.
That's... half good.
A Wolf-Man
I tried to fight it off, but my hands were no match for the tooth and claw of the wolf.  When it was done with me, as it walked away, I saw the wolf change into the form of a man.
It was [werewolf_attacker.GetTitledName]! I hope someone else saw it.
Target Slain
Success! I've ripped that wretched [target_victim.GetTitledName] apart with my own teeth.
Success!  [werewolf_attacker.GetName] ripped [target_victim.GetTitledName] apart.
Success!  I'm not sure how [werewolf_attacker.GetTitledName] did it, but the wolves attacked [target_victim.GetTitledName] and slew [target_victim.GetHerHim].
No less that [target_victim.GetSheHe] deserves.
Tooth and Nail
I tried to fight it off, but my hands were no match for the tooth and claw of the wolf.
Seems it was the better hunter...
Attack Failed
I lunged at [target_victim.GetTitledName], but [target_victim.GetSheHe] threw me off. Before I could attack again, [target_victim.GetHerHis] guards returned and I had to flee.
[werewolf_attacker.GetTitledName] attacked [target_victim.GetTitledName], but was driven off by guards before [werewolf_attacker.GetSheHe] could deliver the killing blow.
We need to try again.
Wolf Attack
The wolf fought hard, but I fought harder.  I managed to throw the wolf off before it could cause any serious injury, then it ran off as my guards arrived.
What a strange wolf...
Werewolf Revealed
When I attacked [target_victim.GetTitledName], not only did [target_victim.GetSheHe] survive, but he caught me transforming.
When [werewolf_attacker.GetTitledName] attacked [target_victim.GetTitledName], not only did [target_victim.GetSheHe] survive, but he caught [werewolf_attacker.GetFirstName] transforming.
I've been exposed.
Werewolf Revealed
I managed to throw off the wolf, but as it escaped, I'm sure I saw it transform into [werewolf_attacker.GetTitledName]
[werewolf_attacker.GetTitledName] is a werewolf.
Assassination Failed... Catastrophically
[target_victim.GetTitledName] was a better fighter than I thought. As I leapt upon [target_victim.GetHerHim], [target_victim.GetSheHe] brought [target_victim.GetHerHis] sword up and slashed my belly.
I don't think I'm going to make it out of this...
Assassination Failed... Catastrophically
Instead of dying like [target_victim.GetSheHe] should have, [target_victim.GetSheHe] slew the wolf and revealed that it was really [werewolf_attacker.GetTitledName]
At least [werewolf_attacker.GetSheHe] died without saying anything about me.
Werewolf Slain
As the wolf leapt at me, I brought up my blade and drove it into its belly.  As it bled out, its form slowly shifted into that of [werewolf_attacker.GetTitledName]
A werewolf.
Werewolf Revealed
Recent events have revealed that your [GetFromRelation], [From.GetBestName], is a monster through-and-through - A werewolf, stalking the people at night.
Recent events have caused your [GetFromRelation], [From.GetBestName], to be revealed as a powerful werewolf.
[From.GetBestName] has foolishly revealed [From.GetHerselfHimself] as a werewolf.  I must be cautious - people may be looking for others.
[From.GetBestName] has been revealed as a werewolf to the realm.
This monster must be destroyed
Perhaps I can take advantage of people's fear towards [From.GetHerHim]
If you have the authority, you'll have reason to arrest and execute [From.GetBestName].
Our enemies will tremble before [From.GetHerHim].
[From.GetSheHe] is a fool, exposing [From.GetHerselfHimself]
It's no concern of mine
Glad to see more of us
[From.GetSheHe] could use a friend at a time like this
An Opening...

Observing [plot_leader.PlotTarget.GetTitledName], I've noticed that [plot_leader.PlotTarget.GetSheHe] is fond of hunting.  During [plot_leader.PlotTarget.GetHerHis] next hunt, I could attack as a wolf and no one would be the wiser.
When is [plot_leader.PlotTarget.GetHerHis] next hunt?
It will be a long wait before I can do this.
I'll invite [plot_leader.PlotTarget.GetHerHim] on a hunting trip myself.
Tell [This.GetTitledName] of the idea to kill [This.PlotTarget.GetTitledName]
Perhaps I can spread rumors of a rare animal in the area.
Forget the hunt – I'll just pay the guards to get “lost” on a normal trip.
This is a bad idea – if I attack directly, I could get hurt.
The Plan is Ready
The hunting trip is finally ready.  Shall we get this plan underway?
All this waiting will finally pay off
The situation's changed.  Let's not do this.
A Plot
[From.GetTitledName] has a plan to get [plot_target.GetTitledName] alone and attack him as a wolf.  No one would know it was anything other than a wild animal attacking.
[From.GetTitledName] has a plan to get a trained wolf to attack [plot_target.GetTitledName].  No one should know it was anything other than a wild animal attack.
Sounds like every thing is accounted for.
Arrange for a wolf to attack [plot_target.GetTitledName]
The Plan is Approved
[From.GetTitledFirstName] approves of my plan to have a “wolf” attack [plot_target.GetTitledName]
The hunt is on
The Plot Proceeds

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has let me know that the plot to kill [From.PlotTarget.GetTitledFirstName] is proceeding well. [From.PlotTarget.GetSubjectPronounCap] will soon be torn apart by a wolf while hunting.
Perfect.
Frenzy
In the heat of battle, I lost control of myself and turned into a wolf.  I killed many of my foes, but everyone there saw it.
Hopefully this will be limited to the commanders.
Hunger
No matter how much I eat, I can't seem to help but wolf down more and more.
I need meat.
Rage Across the Realm
Whenever the moon waxes toward full, I've been finding myself getting angrier and angrier.
Why bother containing my rage?
Running With The Wolves
After a night spent running in the wild with other wolves, I feel free in a way I never could before.
I should do this more often.
A Loud Awakening
I woke up this morning to the sound of a maid screaming when she saw the bed covered in blood.
What did I do last night?
They act like they've never seen me covered in blood before.
Boredom
The court has been boring for quite some time now.  While it has been boring, it has put people's suspicions about me out of their minds.
I guess boredom has its up-sides.
Lost Control
I lost control during the hunt and ended up tearing the prey to pieces.
At least I caught it. Technically.
The Thrill of the Fight
During that last battle, I completely lost myself in the thrill of the fight
I should let out the wolf more often
Regeneration
While my wounds would have laid low any normal man, my body has already overcome its weakness
Much better.
Supernatural Recovery
Although my body and mind had been broken and crippled, the strength of the wolf still runs through my blood and restores my body and mind.
I am renewed!
True Nature Revealed
After my sudden and inexplicable recovery, there's no longer any use in hiding who I am - Everyone now knows that I'm a werewolf.
At least I don't need to hide now.
There has been whisperings around the court – it seems that someone saw me howling at the moon a few nights ago.
Maybe they'll just think I'm crazy
There has been whisperings around the court – it seems that someone saw my hunt a few days ago, including making the kill.
They can't prove anything.

Waking up after a moon-frenzy is always a blur and you only vaguely recall the events of that night, but your muscles ache, your jaw is sore, and your throat hoarse.  You must have been howling for hours.
Waking up after a moon-frenzy is always a blur and you only vaguely recall the events of that night, but you're cold, wet, and still outside.  It seems you didn't even return home.

Waking up after a moon-frenzy is always a blur and you only vaguely recall the events of that night, but you feel wet and sticky.  As you look down, you find yourself covered in blood that doesn't smell like yours.  You vaguely remember making a kill, but not what...
I should wash up.
The peasants of [Root.GetName] are resisting all of my laws and declared that they refuse to submit to a monster
They better not try anything.
The peasants of [Root.GetName] are refusing to pay taxes, claiming they refuse to aid whatever monstrous plans I have.
I don't have any monstrous plans
My soldiers will force them to pay!
The soldiers in [Root.GetName] have been abandoning their duties and leaving the posts.  They claim that they refuse to serve a monster.
Bah! The weak flee while the strong remain!
I received new from [Root.GetName] that many bandits, cutpurses, and neer-do-wells that once resided there have fled to other realms.  It seems they fear being hunted and torn apart by werewolves.
As well they should.
The people of [Root.GetName] sleep soundly at night, knowing their lands are protected.  Where they once feared the howl of wolves, it now is a reassuring sound.
My people are safe.
Military recruitment is going strong in [Root.GetName].  There are rumors that I will turn those who distinguish themselves in battle, and many young men have joined the army to prove themselves.
And they will be rewarded.
I've been playing outside a lot, far away from everyone else, in the woods. Today I saw a wolf!  It came up and talked to me.  Well, it didn't really talk, but I knew what it wanted to say anyway.
I should tell [Root.Guardian.GetFirstName]!
I'll keep this secret. Adults won't understand.
My [GetFromRelation], [From.GetFirstName], has been playing off in the woods a lot, far from everyone else.  [From.GetSheHeCap] even claims to be talking to wolves.
Unsupervised play is good for a child.
[From.GetSheHeCap] shouldn't be allowed to do such dangerous things.
[From.GetFirstName] really enjoyed listening to how I was talking to the wolf, even if I don't think they believed me.
[From.GetFirstName] wasn't happy that I was playing out in the woods, so I'm not allowed to go there anymore.
I'm glad.
Aww.
[From.GetFirstName] has been a rather strange child.  Just yesterday, I saw [From.GetHerHim] growling at people when they got too close.
[From.GetFirstName] just had to have [From.GetHerHis] hair cut again.  It's growing way faster than normal, and [From.GetSheHe] seems to be growing body hair at a young age too...
It seems like every morning, we can't find [From.GetFirstName] in [From.GetHerHis] bed, and have to search all over for [From.GetHerHim], and every morning, we find [From.GetHerHim] sleeping outside.
This is very odd.
Is [From.GetSheHe] a werewolf like me?
[From.GetFirstName] says I shouldn't growl at people.  Even if they get to close and I don't like them.  [From.GetSheHeCap] was acting really strange about it.  Is [From.GetSheHe] planning something?
[From.GetFirstName] says I've been growing too much hair.  But this is the same amount of hair I've always grown.  And [From.GetSheHe] has more hair than me anyway!
[From.GetFirstName] seems worried that I keep sleeping outside.  I like sleeping outside, though.  The bed is too stuffy.
I'm not weird.
I was in the woods, playing with the wolves again, and today one of them started following me home.
Can I keep him?
It's normal for a child to bring home some wild animal and want to keep it as a pet, but a wolf is no ordinary animal.
[From.GetFirstName] will be fine.
That's a dangerous animal!
[From.GetFirstName] agreed to let me keep the wolf as a pet!
I'm gonna name him Hunter.

[From.GetFirstName]'s wolf doesn't seem to like anyone, and lashes out at anyone who comes near it.  Except for [From.GetFirstName], who it follows around like a lost puppy.  There's something unusual about that child.
It bit me!
As I have gotten older, my wolf has become fearful of me and avoids me.  I haven't mistreated it – what's going on?
He's not coming back, is he?
As I have gotten older, my wolf has become more domesticated and friendlier around members of the court
He's basically a dog now.
[FromFrom.GetFirstName] has been a very unusual child, and all the signs seem to be pointing to one thing – [FromFrom.GetSheHe] may a werewolf, or will at least grow to become one.
The child must be brought to a [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle].
Lock [FromFrom.GetHerHim] up in the dungeon, where [FromFrom.GetSheHe] can't hurt anyone.
We must kill this abomination!
Excellent! I'll introduce [FromFrom.GetHerHim] to the realm!
Good for [FromFrom.GetHerHim].
There's nothing I can do about it.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has brought the child [FromFromFrom.GetFirstName] before me.  [From.GetSheHeCap] has noticed some strange abilities and behavior from the child, and suspect that [FromFromFrom.GetSheHe] may be a werewolf.
I will pray for [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] to bless [FromFromFrom.GetHerHim] with strength.
I will pray for [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] to protect [FromFromFrom.GetHerHim] soul.
Some [GetSelectedIngredient_1] should encourage [FromFromFrom.GetHerHis] potential.
I will use some [GetSelectedIngredient_1] to exorcise the demon within [FromFromFrom.GetHerHim].
[From.GetTitledFirstName] is worrying too much.
I haven't done anything wrong, but [From.GetTitledFirstName] has locked me in the dungeon and called me a monster!
I didn't do anything! Please let me out!
[From.GetTitledFirstName] prayed over me and asked [From.Religion.GetRandomGodName] to protect me.
Protect me from what?
[From.GetTitledFirstName] prayed over my child.  The only left to do now is wait and trust [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName].
Okay.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] performed some kind of ritual over me to get [From.Religion.GetRandomGodName] to help me.
Help me do what?
[From.GetTitledFirstName] performed a ritual over [FromFromFromFrom.GetFirstName] to get [From.Religion.GetRandomGodName] to help [FromFromFromFrom.GetHerHim].
We spoke to [From.GetTitledFirstName], and he thinks this is all an over-reaction.
I agree – there's nothing wrong with me.
I spoke to [From.GetTitledFirstName], but [From.GetSheHe] doesn't see the problem.  [From.GetSheHeCap] thinks I'm just over-reacting.
What does [From.GetSheHe] know.
Now that my [GetFromRelation], [From.GetFirstName] is of age, [From.GetSheHe] should reveal [From.GetHerselfHimself] as a werewolf and take [From.GetHerHis] proper place in society.
Yes, it is time.
No, [From.GetSheHe] can move at [From.GetHerHis] own pace.
My [GetFromRelation] feels that it's time for me to reveal myself as a werewolf.  This will prove that I am a true ruler and fit to lead my people.
But I'm not a werewolf...
I'll do it!
I'm not ready...
My [GetFromRelation] has listened to my suggestion, but it turns out that [From.GetSheHe] has not become a werewolf.
Oh.
My [GetFromRelation] has revealed [From.GetHerselfHimself] to the world. [From.GetSheHe] is strong and fit to rule.
My [GetFromRelation] has refused to reveal [From.GetHerselfHimself] to the world. I can only hope [From.GetSheHe] sees the light soon.
This is my [GetFromRelation], in whom I am well pleased.
I am disappointed.

On the night of my 16th birthday, I could feel a beast inside me take control.  I took on a form not of man nor wolf, but some powerful creatures in-between.  However, this was not enough to escape my prison, and all it did was let my captors know my nature.
Knowing won't save them.

In the middle of the night, there were strange sounds coming from the dungeon.  I brought guards only to find a monstrous wolf-man in [From.GetTitledName]'s cell – As I suspected, [From.GetSheHe] is a werewolf.
I knew it!
Everything has pressed so heavily on my, I feel my mind cracking under the strain.  I'm not only not in control of my own life, but I'm also losing control over the wolf within.
I have to keep trying anyway
It's easier to just give in.
Every part of my life has been terrible.  Is there any point in even trying to control what I am?
I should just let go.
My injuries have stuck with me.  My ability to heal has been weakened by trying to keep my power in check.
I should let go. Use the strength of the wolf.
I just need patience.  I'll heal in time.
I try to keep control over myself, but that just doesn't come naturally.  This just isn't me.
I should just let loose.
With the battle raging, the wolf in me wants to transform, fight the enemy myself, and feel their blood in my teeth.
No, I need to focus on commanding my troops.
Why should I hold myself back?
While I was traveling, some peasant boy starting mocking me in front of my traveling companions and the boy's friends.
Transforming and ripping his hand off would teach him not to mock a [Root.GetTitle].
I should just ignore him.

The last few days have been an unending chain of stress, complaining vassals, and “urgent” matters of trivial importance.  I want to transform and run off, spend some time away from the stresses of modern life and embrace the wolf.
It's time for the wolf to take over.
I need to stay in control.
Cursed!
Ever since you insulted that shaman on the streets, you've been feeling deathly ill, and a hunger like none you've ever experienced...
Brains?
Form the Horde
As you succumb to the hunger and lose your last ounce of humanity, you know that just as you led in life, so too shall you lead in death.
Glory to the Horde!
Faith Lost
As the curse drains your mind, so too does it drain your faith. You find that you no longer believe in anything but whatever force brought you back from the grave.
The gods have no power here.
The Horde Grows
With our recent success, the horde grows in size, and our enemies' dead rise up to join us.
Glory to the Horde!
Submit to the Horde.
As your realm and your body crumbles to the plague, you join your join your strength to the all-consuming horde.
Glory to the Horde!
Plague Spreads
As the horde spreads over your realm and you are finally defeated, you succumb to the plague yourself.
Truly, all is lost.
Province Exterminated
Over the months since conquering this region, numerous civilians have resisted the horde. Now they have faded into obscurity, and most have been turned or wiped out.
Glory to the Horde!
Province Reclaimed

In the months since retaking this province from the undead plague, your troops have worked hard to hunt down and exterminate any remnants of it. Finally you can claim some success, and braver colonists from your homeland have begun to move into the now-empty homes and castles here.
Excellent.
Zombie law change
You lead an army of undead and there are no limits to your authority.
Excellent.

For some time now my [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName], has been overcome with bodily pains. I have now been informed that the symptoms are due to a plague that controls the body after death.
Your body is full of strange aches and pains as if your body was dying with every breath yet would continue on without you.  You have contracted the plague of the living death.
As your heart beats its last, your pain begins to subside.  Thought fades from your mind, and what remains naught but a hunger.
Assassination Plot
One taste of the Poisoned Apple and the victim's eyes will close forever in the Sleeping Death.
I'll go myself in a disguise so complete no one will ever suspect.
Give the victim a cursed apple.
I'd prefer something that kills right away.
An upsetting meal
A wonderful feast! Boiled beef, roast fowl, wheat bread... and look, fresh apples!
I think there was something wrong with that apple...
Only a little, I'm not hungry.
Assassination Detected
[target_victim.GetTitledName] is dead, but not without incident.  Someone found that the death was caused by the apples I brought – they know I'm the killer.
I'm not sure if I won or lost.
Poison!
Poison! My body is growing numb, but as my sight fades, I die loudly cursing my killer's name!
Curse that sorcerer, [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]!
Assassination Detected
After eating the apple. [target_victim.GetTitledName] has fallen into a deep slumber.  Unfortunately, the apple acted too fast and people know this is my fault
[target_victim.GetSheHeCap] didn't even have the courtesy  to die first.
Poison!
Poison! I can feel myself losing consciousness, but I know who is  to blame – that vile magician [FromFrom.GetTitledName]!
Curse that sorcerer, [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]!
Success! The curse has ended the life of [From.GetTitledName]. [From.GetSubjectPronounCap] died not knowing the name of [From.GetPossPronoun] killer.
[From.GetHerHisCap] breath will still, [From.GetHerHis] blood congeal...
Poison! My body is growing numb. Someone, please help me! [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap]...
column3: Du poison ! Mon corps est tout engourdi. S'il vous plaît, j'ai besoin d'aide ! [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap]...
column4: Gift! Mein Körper wird allmählich völlig taub. Helft mir bitte! [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap]...
column6: ¡Veneno! Mi cuerpo se entumece. ¡Que alguien me ayude! [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap]...

column2: Who would hate me so?
column3: Qui me déteste tant pour vouloir m'empoisonner ?

column2: Success! [From.GetName] has eaten the apple and fallen into a deep sleep.  No one suspects a thing.
Behold, the Sleeping Death.
Poison! I can barely keep my eyes open. Someone, please help me! [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap]...
Was it something I ate?
[target_victim.GetTitledFirstName] didn't even take a bite.  [target_victim.GetSheHeCap] has escaped unharmed.
[target_victim.GetSheHeCap] knows... Wait, [target_victim.GetSheHe] just wasn't hungry.
There was something very suspicious about the food served today.  Is someone trying to murder me?
Who would hate me so?
[target_victim.GetTitledFirstName] was suspicious of the apple and had a [target_victim.Religion.GetPriestTitle] look at it.  They found the enchantment and revealed my identity!
This is bad...
A poisoned apple? What is this, a fairy tale?
[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] is surely guilty!
In my studies, I've had some inspiration – A cursed apple.  While it doesn't always cause death, eternal slumber is the next best thing.
We'll see who's the fairest of them all.
I'll need some funds first.
I should pick something more lethal
Tell [This.GetTitledName] of the idea to kill [This.PlotTarget.GetTitledName]
Ask [This.GetTitledName] for funds to kill [This.PlotTarget.GetTitledName]
My co-conspirator, [From.GetTitledName], has let me know that [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledName] will be fed a poisoned apple at an upcoming feast.
Death or eternal slumber. Both good.
Approve the plan.
My co-conspirator, [From.GetTitledName],will use magic to curse [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledName] at an upcoming banquet, but magic always comes with a price. In this case, gold.
Very well – death or eternal sleep are both good.
It isn't worth it to mere sleep.
Inform [This.GetTitledName] that I will not pay
[From.GetTitledName] approves of my idea to curse [From.PlotTarget.GetTitledName] with an enchanted apple.
Make the preparations
Poison [This.GetTitledName] at the feast next month

[From.GetTitledName] has let me know that the plot to kill [From.PlotTarget.GetTitledName] is proceeding well. [From.PlotTarget.GetSubjectPronounCap] will eat the enchanted apple at a feast in one month.
Classic!
[From.GetTitledName] has sent me the necessary funds to curse [From.PlotTarget.GetTitledName]...
column3: [From.GetTitledName] m'a envoyé l'argent nécessaire pour maudire [From.PlotTarget.GetTitledName]...

column2: [From.GetTitledName] has refused to pay the cost of my magic.
It was worth asking.  I'll do it anyway.
Then [From.GetSheHe]'ll get what [From.GetSheHe] paid for. Nothing.
Cast which aura?
Aura of Intimidation
Improve martial skill and siege damage at the cost of diplomacy
Aura of Presence
Improve people's opinion at the cost of intrigue
Aura of Shadows
Improve intrigue at the cost of diplomacy
Cast something else
Receive more options.
Aura of Majesty
Gain prestige at the cost of piety
Aura of Valor
Improve personal combat at the cost of military leadership
Aura of The People
Reduce revolt risk at the cost of vassal opinion
Cancel
Don't cast a spell.
The spell is cast.  From within the bounds of the mystic circle spouts of torrent of flame and inside stands a young dragon wearing what appears to be a dragon's version of the vestments of a steward
A dragon steward? That works.
The spell is cast.  As a chill takes hold over the room, a huge man in heavy armor stands in the circle.  He towers over you, head brushing against the ceiling.
This giant will make my enemies tremble.

Before the spell is even completed, a man appears before you to answer your summons with an offer of contract.  This creature of skill and power will serve you faithfully for four and twenty year, until at the last day's final bell, you will return with him, your soul consigned to hell.
Who snares the devil holds him tight.
This price is too steep. Begone!

Completing the spell, a stillness comes over the room, until the door bursts forth and a grim specter moves in, drawing a chain clasped around its middle, long and winding locked to cash boxes, padlocks, ledgers, deeds, and steel purses.
So, I take it this specter's good with money?
When the spell was complete, immediately a frightful genie rose out of the earth, saying “What wouldst thou with me? I am the slave of the summoner and will obey thee in all things”
I'm sure I can find a use for you.
When the smoke and lights of the summoning cleared, before me stood a strange, inhuman man.  He claimed to have been a general in service to King Solomon and now offers his service to me.
Impressive credentials.
The spell is complete. Before you stands a form neither fully human nor wolf, but some dire mix of both. It lunges at you, but is stopped my the spell.
Heel!
The spell finishes.  Before me stands a soldier in full armor, yet he is not entirely there – you feel that if you were to reach out, your hand would pass right through him.
A soldier that doesn't fear death...
When the spell completed, a body appeared before you, pale and unmoving. At first you though the spell had failed and summoned a corpse until it stood up
A success!
When the spell completed, a man appeared before you in simple robes.  He claimed to be son of god, here to save you.
The church won't like this, but I can make this work.
When the spell finished, a man stood before you with a vacant stare and rotting flesh.  There was no mistaking this man for anything but a corpse save for one fact – he still moves.
The start of an army of the moving dead?

It has been twenty-four years, yet it still feels too soon.  [mephisto.GetFirstName] has come to me to collect what is owed.  There's no where I can flee that he can't follow and no way I can fight him.
Please.  I don't want to die...
The spell is complete, but I think something went wrong.  A dragon appeared before me, but seemed unfettered by the spell.  He simply looked on me with disdain and walked out of the circle.
I have a bad feeling about this
The spell is complete, but I think something went wrong.  A man appeared before me, but when I tried to give him orders, he just laughed and vanished in a cloud of black smoke.
That's rarely a good sign.
The spell is complete, but I think something went wrong.  The person before me wore foreign clerical vestments and was unhindered by the bonds the spell should have place and simply left with a scowl
They could cause trouble

The spell is complete, but I think something went wrong.  A wolf appeared before me and lunged at me, unhindered by the magical protections. Its claws and teeth sunk in painfully, but I managed to thow it off and it ran away.
This is bad. This is really bad.
The spell is complete, but I think something went wrong.  Instead of some powerful creature, a weak peasent appeared, seemingly sickly and unwell.
I feel sick..

The spell is complete, but something is off.. A very attractive figure appeared before me, yet I get the feeling that they are in someway unwell.  When I looked away in thought, they somehow escaped the summoning circle.
Something isn't right.
Enough is enough.  I've cast a banishment spell and every magically summoned being in by court should be forced back to wherever they call home.
Good riddance
All summoned creatures are banished from the realm
I thought my spell had worked, but I've heard that as soon as I released [From.GetTitledFirstName] from prison, [From.GetSheHe] went back to [From.GetHerHis] old ways.
I was tricked!
It's expected that every dragon will eventually lend their breath to the Eternal Flames.  Now seems like a good time.
I'll make travel plans.
I will visit the temple.
There are two eternal flames in the isles.
With the continental Eternal Flames destroyed by the humans, I will need to travel to the western isles to visit the flames there.
I will visit the flame in Galloway
I will aid the flame in Kent
[Root.GetTitledName] took a pious pilgrimage to strengthen the Eternal Flame in Galloway.
[Root.GetTitledName] took a pious pilgrimage to strengthen the Eternal Flame in Kent.
There are three flames I can reach by land.
With the Flames on the isles destroyed by the humans, I will need to sail across the channel to seek one of the flames on the mainland.
I will renew the flame in Sjaelland.
I will travel to Uppland.
I will see the southern flame in Plock.
[Root.GetTitledName] took a pious pilgrimage to strengthen the Eternal Flame in Sjaelland.
[Root.GetTitledName] took a pious pilgrimage to strengthen the Eternal Flame in Uppland.
[Root.GetTitledName] took a pious pilgrimage to strengthen the Eternal Flame in Plock.
My things are packed, everything is in order. Soon, I shall see fair Galloway and its Eternal Flame.
My journey begins!
I have my traveling supplies ready.  I shall strike out to strengthen the Eternal Flame in Kent, where dragons first landed on the isles.
My things are packed, everything is in order. Soon, I shall lend my strength to the central flame in Sjaelland
I already live only a short distance from one of the Eternal Flames. I will present myself to the temple and prepare to aid it.
I shall stay here, then.
Everything is packed.  It's time to go to Landvaettir's eternal flame in Uppland.
I have my traveling supplies ready.  I shall strike out to strengthen Wawel's Eternal Flame in Plock
Galloway

We have finally arrived in Galloway.  We will pay a visit to the temple at Whithorn, then head north to visit the Eternal Flame at Torhouse.  Legends say that this flame was created by the god Dewi to protect and support the dragons furthest in the west.  The flame burns without fuel or tinder above three stones at the center of a stone circle.
A green and pleasant land!
The rain has been pouring down for days.  It's been impossible to make and progress on the flooded roads, and traveling through plains or woods in this weather is slow and miserable.
This is a test of my faith and dedication.
This is a waste of time.  I should have stayed home.

You look out across the beautiful valley stretching out before you. It would be a wonderful moment, if not for the fact that there should be no valley here. You are a pilgrim in an unfamiliar land and you have no idea where you are.
If only I hadn't listened to those useless humans that gave me directions.
If only I'd listened more to those humans that gave me directions.

Much of the trip has been through the outskirts of land, on roads not protected by any chief or king.  This has become all too apparent as we came across a group of brigands demanding a 'toll' in exchange for safe passafe.
Pay up.
I'll pay with claw and sword!
The old wooden bridge has carried many pilgrims in its day. It creaks suspiciously as you step on it.
No time to stop. I'm sure it will hold.
Stop and repair it.
These people deserve a stone bridge.  I will pay for its construction.
As winter sets in, the weather beings to turn.  A blizzard has set in and the road in becoming increasingly difficult.
We need to push on
We will stay a few days at the next inn we come across.

You lie awake at night, pondering the purpose of your journey.  Every dragon is supposed to lend their breath to the Eternal Flames, but so few do.  What would happen if they went out? Could they not just be reignited? And while they protected the dragons of old, do they still server some higher purpose?
I will trust the gods and heed their commands.
I already started the journey, so I may as well finish it.  That's reason enough.

I my journey, I met a human along the road.  When I told [curious_human.GetHerHim] why I was traveling, they were curious about my faith.  I explained our history and beliefs about dragons' souls when [curious_human.GetSheHe] asked where humans fit in.
Human souls are strengthened through hard work.
I don't know... I should look in to that for you.
Humans don't matter.
The Flood

There have been heavy rains in the area and the road you've been following has been cut off by a wide and swift river.  You can just fly over it, but a number of local farmers have been cut off and need help getting across.
I'll take the people, but their carts are livestock aren't worth the effort
It will be a lot of work, but I can handle it.
Well, good luck with that.
The Flood

There have been strong rains in the area lately, and the valley that you need to cross has been transformed into a sizeable lake. The water is still rising, so you start to build a large raft in order to cross. When you're almost finished building it, a group of farmers show up and explain that they also need to cross the valley in order to get back to their homes. They bring with them a number of animals that they've rescued from the flood.
None of these humans are setting their filthy feet on my raft.
Bring the farmers with all their animals.
Only let them bring the cats and dogs.
On the road, I ended up meeting another dragon on his way to the Eternal Flame.  We chatted a long the way, and it made the whole trip seem much shorter
I had a great time!
On the road, I met a traveling merchant heading back from his own trip to the Eternal Flame.  He claimed he was selling holy relics to pilgrims and promised great prices
One of the skulls of the Lernaean Hydra
A torch with fire from the Eternal Flame
A coin from Fafnir the Great's horde
Undoubtedly all fakes
Great prices? I can't afford any of this.

You have spent the last fews days of your journey on water. The vessel you are travelling on rocks gently in the breeze, as the sailors go about their business. Being on board ship is quite unlike being on land – so much is different, so many strange words for all the things here. Starboard? Abaft? Aground? What does it all mean?
This is an excellent opportunity to learn some new skills.
When will I need to sail a boat? I will spend my time in prayer.

As you stop to make camp near a river crossing along with other pilgrims, you observe a group of builders working on a new bridge just upstream. You walk up to them and see that the arches of the bridge are already half completed. The master builder notices your interest and walks up to you and offers to tell you about the construction techniques they are using.
Yes, tell me more about it.
Nobles build castles. This is for peasants.
Bridges are for those who can't just fly over.

The journey has been long and hard and your entire body aches.  Far from the castle kitchens the food is barely edible, and on top of that you seem to feel cold all the time.  Perhaps you were not quite cut out for this pilgrimage thing.
It's the Flame that matters. My body can wait.
Maybe this was a bad idea.  I should rest for a while.
As I was heading along the trail, I came across a village in rather poor condition.  It turns out that a blight wiped out their crops and they are having trouble making ends meet.
I can spare some money to help them.
It takes more than a sob story to get my money.
As I laid down to sleep, I began to think about my parents, their behavior, and the example they've set for me.
They weren't the best role models.
They raised me right.
Every night, there has been a single, bright start in the sky that has caught my attention.  It outshines those around it and has remained in a constant position over my destination.
[Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] is guiding and protecting me.
It's a star. So what?
It's an ill omen.
Riders approach...

Thundering hooves are heard down the road. The pilgrims look with apprehension at the rising dust cloud. As the riders close, steel armour and steel-tipped lances reflect the bright sunlight. The tension rises, but then a collective sigh of relief is heard as the banner of the holy knights is seen flying above the mass of armored men. The knights halt before the pilgrims and graciously offer to accompany you on the road.

Thundering hooves are heard down the road. The pilgrims look with apprehension at the rising dust cloud. As the riders close, steel armour and steel-tipped lances reflect the bright sunlight. The tension rises, but then a collective sigh of relief is heard as they dismount and bow before me, recognizing me as the Sapphire Flame.  They are an order of holy knights here to escort me on my visit.
Praised be [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]! A most welcome escort!
Never trust armed men who appear out of nowhere.

As the evening approaches after a long day on the road, you come upon several campfires. Around the fires you find a group of holy knights, resting after a long day's ride. They invite you to share their meal and trade stories.
Discuss theology with the knights.
Trade stories of war.

During the last couple of days, you have made company on the road with a holy knight on his way to the same destination. You have lively and interesting conversations, and you find that you have many things in common,
How unexpected, to make a new friend this far from home.
I have no need for friends.
Kent

You have arrived in Kent.  When the dragons first arrived here, Zirnita created on of the Eternal Flames in an underground chamber to protect the early dragons.  Though the Christians have built one of their temples over it, there are still secret ways for worshippers to get to the flame.
The long road is over.
Sjaelland

After the powerful yet impatient dragon Sigurd was cursed to become human for trying to slay Fafnir, in his rage he attempted to extinguish the Eternal Flame in Sjaelland.  Banding together, the dragons were able to drive him off, but at the cost of many lives.  When strengthening Sjaelland's flame, we not only fulfill our duty, but honor those who died to protect it.
Their sacrifice will not be forgotten.
The Eternal Flame

The Eternal Flames were lit by the gods as we fled west to escape the constant attacks by the numerous humans jealous of our power and birthright.  The flames would protect our settlements from the elements, and in exchange, we would lend our breath to keep them burning.

The Eternal Flames were lit by the gods as we fled west to escape the constant attacks by the numerous humans jealous of our power and birthright.  The flames would protect our settlements from the elements and heat the world-egg to keep the next world alive until it can hatch.  In exchange for the Flames' protection, every dragon is charges with lending their breath to keep the Flames active.
I will fulfill my duty.
Uppland

You have made it up Uppland, home of the Eternal Flame birthed by Landvættir to protect us as we fled from our old homes in Asaland and Sumeria.  Our old settlements grew in the light and protection of the flame until we were once again driven out by the growing human threat.
We will reclaim our heritage.
Plock

The oldest of the Eternal Flames, the Flame at Plock was created by Wawel to protect our first settlements as we fled from attacks in the east.  Legends say that humans could once breathe fire, but gre jealous of the strength of dragonfire and tried to consume this Flame to take the power for themselves. Instead it burned their mouths and they lost what fire they had and survived only by being taught to make file from sticks and stone.
I should see the ancient sites while I am here.

As you walk around on this holy ground, you ponder the secrets and the essences of the gods.  The teachings of the priest and seers have never seemed as real to you as they do now.  Imagine the knowledge contained in the scriptures and writing here.
I will learn much from the draconic histories.
Study does not strengthen the soul.

The presence of the Eternal Flame is overwhelming! I realize that all my life up to this point has merely been preparation for this journey.  How wonderous it is for the light of the Eternal Flames to finally shine on me!  From now on, I shall dedicate my life to the teachings of the gods.
Praise [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]!
Travelling all this way to see the Eternal Flame, you had expected more than this. It's pretty much just a bonfire, which you've seen plenty of.  This isn't anything special
That's it?

The bustling mass as pilgrims is impressive, as are the many languages and the color and style of clothes, horns, and clothes among the dragons visiting.  You're standing at a place where the roads meet, and that is a natural place for both dragons and dragonborn to gather.
Take the opportunity to observe different languages and customs.
Take the opportunity to meet new people.

The stories of other pilgrims all spoke of how impressive this place is. Now that you can see it with your own eyes, you can only join in their praise. You are glad that you came here, to one of the holiest places among dragon-kind.
It was well worth the journey!

As you approach the holy temple, you overhear a theological discussion between several priests. You stop and eagerly engage them in conversation, expanding upon several of your favorite topics. They are very impressed by your knowledge and invite you to hold a lecture for a group of assembled religious scholars.
I will be most pleased the share my knowledge.

As soon as I entered the temple, the priest recognized me as the Sapphire Flame.  He was very eager for me to deliver a sermon today.  I didn't have anything prepared, but I agreed anyway.  Now I just need to determine the topic
Something simple – the importance of hording gold.
I will teach how dragonkind needs to expand.
Our enemies are everywhere – I will stress vigilance.
I will talk about the Eternal Flames – that's why I'm here.

When I first looked into the Eternal Flame, I same move than simply fire – I saw images moving through the flame.  I've heard of people seeing visions in the fire, and now I find myself seeing them as well.
I see wealth and prosperity.
I see visions of the gods.
I see images of peace and tranquility.
I see realms bowing before me.
I... I can't understand these images.
So far from home, all alone, and so many lovely people in the same situation as me. It's a great opportunity for some fun, isn't it?
I'm sure I can find someone to keep me company.
That's not what I'm here for

This holy place is bustling with pilgrims from all over the world, and a myriad of accents and languages mingle in the parks and plazas. In this great cultural melting pot, should there not also be room for me to express who I really am?
The folks at home will never know
I'm here with a purpose, and that isn't it.

All these magnificent temples built in your honor! Oh the glory! And all these pilgrims - finally you may revel in their adulation. Perhaps you should reveal yourself to the masses who have come to worship you?
Speak to them!
No, I shall enjoy this glorious time in silence.
I came her to attend to the Flame and show my devotions, but with so many luxuries and taverns here, surely I can take some time fo fun behorehand.
To the tavern!
The Flame comes first.  I have to control myself.
I find a secluded area outside of town to go through the ritual cleanings expected of all pilgrims before lending their breath to the Eternal Flame.
A clean body reflects a clean soul.
Is all this pageantry really necessary?
You arrive and the temple to the Eternal Flame and speak to the priest.  Due to the crowds of pilgrims, there is a wait before you can perform your duties and he arranges a time for your visit.
Don't worry, I know how to pass the time
This option is available due to you having the Hedonist trait.
This option is available due to you having the Lustful trait.
This option is available due to you having the Drunkard trait.
I will wait until my turn arrives
I have to wait?

As you wait for your turn, you come across a dragonborn gathering ritual ingredients  Because dragonborn cannot breathe fire on their own, they need to develop a special potion in order to lend their breath to the flame.
Help him out
Keep him company
Leave him be
With there still being time before I could lend my breath to the Flame, you checked by the temple to see if you could help the priest with any of his duties.
I will perform the blessings at local shrines
I'm not above helping clean the temple
I can help the priest with all the paperwork he has piled up.
On second thought, I'll just rest for a bit
I as walked through the temple, I noticed that the priest seemed to be out, but the temple valuables were still there...
No one checked the reliquary.
I'll just take a little from the coffers.
I'm not going to steal from the temple!

While I was trying to get my way into the temple valuables, the priest walked in and caught you red handed.  There was little you could do as he threw you out of the temple.  While he'll still have to let you in for your pilgrimage, it's clear he'll be keeping a very close eye on you.
Perhaps I shouldn't rob someone who talks to the gods.
Without any trouble you broke in to the reliquary, grabbed the first box you saw, and got out, and it seems no one is the wiser.
I wonder what I got
It's interesting to see all the variety of pilgrims that visit the city with different languages and cultures.  As you think about it, it seems like a great opportunity for a bit of fun.
I'm sure someone needs a bit of company.
I need to control myself.

As a dragonborn, you are not able to breathe fire yourself, but are still expected to tend to the Eternal Flame.  To do this, there is a ritual potion that you will need to make instead, but it will need some expensive ingredients and a bit of your blood
But I need my blood...

It is time for you to lend your breath to the Eternal Flame.  You are brought to an enshrined area before a flame that consumes no fuel and has an odd blue hue.  This flame was created by the gods and maintained by the dragons that came before you, and now it is time for you to lend your fire to the flame as well.
Praise [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]!

This pilgrimage has turned your thoughts towards your soul and the next world.  You've been taught that a dragon's soul is that of gold and that getting more will strengthen it to prepare you for the next world, but still wonder just how prepared it is.
My soul is secure.
This option is available due to the amount of gold you have.
I should get more gold...
My horde is NOT small!
Blasphemous fools! Do they not know their Lord? How dare they throw you out of your own temple?
I shall have my vengeance.
You have made friends with [From.GetTitledName].
Great!

It is time for you to strengthen the Eternal Flame.  You are brought to an enshrined area before a flame that consumes no fuel and has an odd blue hue.  This flame was created by the gods and maintained by the dragons that came before you, and when you pour in the potion, will will have done the same.
Praise [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]!
You have finally returned from your pilgrimage. It was a rewarding and interesting journey, and you'd do it all again if you could. Still, it's good to be back home.
A great experience!

You have finally returned from your pilgrimage. It didn't turn out quite as expected, and perhaps you shouldn't have gone there in the first place. But there's no changing it now, at least you're home again and can start forgetting about it.
I won't tell my family what really happened out there
You have finally made it back from your pilgrimage, and it was one of the worst experiences of your life.  At least your home now, any practially anything that happens here will be an improvement.
At least I'll never have to do that again.

You have finally returned from your pilgrimage. Though the insolent rats did not recognize you or pay you proper homage, it was still an enlightening experience. Now there is plenty of time to prepare the day of reckoning.
They will taste divine vengeance!
Attempt to steal the artifact.
Your attempted theft is caught.
Most virtuous [Root.GetTitledFirstName], of course we, the keepers of the divine hordes, can lend you 300 gold.  All we ask in return is your future assistance in certain matters as they might arise.

Great [Root.GetTitledFirstName], of course we, the servants of the greatest Prince of Hell, can lend you 300 gold.  All we ask in return is your future assistance in certain matters as they might arise.
Most virtuous [Root.GetTitledFirstName], of course we, the chosen of Merddyn Emrys, can lend you 300 gold.  All we ask in return is your future assistance in certain matters as they might arise.
Most virtuous [Root.GetTitledFirstName], of course we, the soldiers of the sky god, can lend you 300 gold.  All we ask in return is your future assistance in certain matters as they might arise.

Most virtuous [Root.GetTitledFirstName], of course we, the servants of the judge of souls, can lend you 300 gold.  All we ask in return is your future assistance in certain matters as they might arise.
Khaire, virtuous [Root.GetTitledFirstName], of course we, the warriors of Ares, can lend you 300 gold.  All we ask in return is your future assistance in certain matters as they might arise.

Ave et salve, virtuous [Root.GetTitledFirstName], of course we, the fraternity in service of Mars, can lend you 300 gold.  All we ask in return is your future assistance in certain matters as they might arise.
Most virtuous [Root.GetTitledFirstName], of course we, the chosen warriors of Surtr, can lend you 300 gold.  All we ask in return is your future assistance in certain matters as they might arise.
Your majesty, this aggression is completely unwarranted! The Order servers the gods, but, one has to wonder, do you?
Your majesty, this aggression is completely unwarranted! The Order fights for [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName], but, one has to wonder, do you?

Most righteous [Root.GetTitledFirstName], I have a humble request for you in light of your debt to us. There is no rest in our defense against the infidel and we have desperate need of warriors to lead our men. Thus, I would like to extend this opportunity to your able and noble son [FromFrom.GetFirstName] to serve in our ranks. Naturally, this would disinherit him. Sincerely,\n\nGrand Master [From.GetFirstName]
Very well, it's a good life
Pay them back instead
Never!
My liege, the Golden Order stand ready to serve you in defense of dragon-kind's security, land, and wealth! [From.Religion.GetRandomGodName],\n\nGrand Master [From.GetFirstName]

My dear [Root.GetTitledFirstName], the Order needs more castles in order to train troops and generate a supporting income. I am willing to cancel your debt to us if you will simply allow us to build a castle in [FromFrom.GetName]. \n\nGrand Master [From.GetFirstName]
It's for a good cause.
Pay them back instead
Never!
The Golden Order have built a castle in [Root.GetName]
Impressive!
My [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName], has requested to join the Golden Order in their struggle against the infidels, even though this will forever disinherit him.
Go with my blessing.
[This.GetTitledFirstName] joins the Golden Order.
Absolutely not!
[This.GetTitledFirstName] is disappointed.

Most righteous [Root.GetTitledFirstName], the Order needs more castles in order to train troops and generate a supporting income. It has come to my attention that there is a suitable location in your demesne - in [FromFrom.GetName] to be specific. I am willing to pay you 100 gold in exchange for the right to construct a fortress there.\n\nGrand Master [From.GetFirstName]
A reasonable request.

Mighty [Root.GetTitledFirstName], I have a humble request for your in light of your debt to us.  There is no rest in our defense against the infidels that surround you. To bolster our ranks, we would like to extend this opportunity for your to send your son [FromFrom.GetFirstName] to serve in our ranks. Naturally, this would disinhert him.\n\nGrand Master [Root.GetTitledFirstName]
My liege, the Army of Baal stand ready to serve you and the legions of hell.

My dear [Root.GetTitledFirstName], the Army of Baal needs more castles in order to train troops and generate a supporting income. I am willing to cancel your debt to us if you will simply allow us to build a castle in [FromFrom.GetName]. \n\nGrand Master [From.GetFirstName]
The Army of Baal have built a castle in [Root.GetName]

My [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName], has requested to join the Army of Baal in their struggle to spread the will of [From.Religion.GetRandomGodName], even though this will forever disinherit him.
[This.GetTitledFirstName] joins the Army of Baal.

Most righteous [Root.GetTitledFirstName], the Army of Baal needs more castles in order to train troops and generate a supporting income. It has come to my attention that there is a suitable location in your demesne - in [FromFrom.GetName] to be specific. I am willing to pay you 100 gold in exchange for the right to construct a fortress there.\n\nGrand Master [From.GetFirstName]

Most righteous [Root.GetTitledFirstName], I have a humble request for you in light of your debt to us. There is no rest in our defense against the infidel and we have desperate need of warriors to lead our men. Thus, I would like to extend this opportunity to your able and noble son [FromFrom.GetFirstName] to serve in our ranks. Naturally, this would disinherit him. Sincerely,\n\nGrand Master [From.GetFirstName]
Very well, it's a good life
My liege, Y Ddraig Goch stand ready to serve you in defense against the infidels! Praise [From.Religion.GetRandomGodName],\n\nGrand Master [From.GetFirstName]

My dear [Root.GetTitledFirstName], Y Ddraig Goch needs more castles in order to train troops and generate a supporting income. I am willing to cancel your debt to us if you will simply allow us to build a castle in [FromFrom.GetName]. \n\nGrand Master [From.GetFirstName]
Y Ddraig Goch have built a castle in [Root.GetName]
My [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName], has requested to join Y Ddraig Goch in their struggle against the infidels, even though this will forever disinherit him.
[This.GetTitledFirstName] joins Y Ddraig Goch

Most righteous [Root.GetTitledFirstName], Y Ddraig Goch needs more castles in order to train troops and generate a supporting income. It has come to my attention that there is a suitable location in your demesne - in [FromFrom.GetName] to be specific. I am willing to pay you 100 gold in exchange for the right to construct a fortress there.\n\nGrand Master [From.GetFirstName]

Most righteous [Root.GetTitledFirstName], I have a humble request for you in light of your debt to us. There is no rest in our defense against the infidel and we have desperate need of warriors to lead our men. Thus, I would like to extend this opportunity to your able and noble son [FromFrom.GetFirstName] to serve in our ranks. Naturally, this would disinherit him. Sincerely,\n\nGrand Master [From.GetFirstName]

The Golden Order

A group of holy warriors defending the horde of Fafnir have, in light of recent events, offered military aid to all dragon kind to help repel the infidel invaders from rightful draconic lands.  They are also willing to provide loans to help draconic rulers improve their defences and reduce foreign encroachment.
They could be useful.
Glorified lizards guarding a cave don't worry me.
The Army of Baal

Recently, a number of young men have begun to flock to the service of the Baal, a powerful prince of Hell.  These men, under the secret orders of their master have begun to militarize and devote themselves to the defense of their faith and the conquest of their foreign enemies.
They could be useful.
A deluded rabble is of no concern.
Y Ddraig Goch

Recently a seer had a vision of two dragon, one red and one white, engaged in a great battle.  When the red one stood triumphant, the seer declared that this was a sign of our victory over the infidels. A host of young men have rallied under the banner of the red dragon pledging to aid the Druidic faithful.
A welcome prophecy!
Old men staring at lizards don't intimidate me.
The Soldiers of Horus

After receiving a vision from Horus, a former soldier has rallied all faithful followers of the Egyptian gods together to push back again the declining worship of the gods by pushing out foreign influences.  These zealous warriors call themselves the Soldiers of Horus
The gods favor us
A man with a bird's head isn't exactly intimidating.
Servants of Anubis

After the diseases that have plagued the land, a growing and vocal group of people have claimed that this spreading death has begun because people have not respected Anubis, the god of death.  They have taken up arms to push against the heathens that don't honor the gods of Egypt.
Perhaps these infidels are the cause...
Their false dog-god has nothing to do with this.
Ares' Phalanx

The faith in the gods of Greece have waned since the rise of the Christians, but have once again begun to gain ground.  A number of soldier's pledged to the service of the god of war have rallied together to regain the ground that's been lost.
They could be useful.
I don't fear the dead gods of a dead religion.
The Sons of Mars

With Rome back in the hands of its gods, combat-ready men throughout the old empire have banded together to help reclaim the lands that have been lost to them.  Claiming Rome's heritage as descendants of the god of war, they call themselves the Sons of Mars.
Rome rises again!
Deluded fools.
Champions of Vígríðr

With recent events the Jotnar have gained a strong degree of popularity and authority over their Norse neighbors.  As their numbers have risen, increasing numbers of men have pledged themselves to server Surtr in Ragnarok and called themselves the Champions of Vígríðr
They could be useful.
Deluded fools.
Sensing a moment of weakness, my [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledName] has issued a challenge.  Soon, we will fight over my title as [Root.GetPrimaryTitles].
Bring it!
There isn't any way out of this, is there?
Hrnng...
It appears that [challenger.GetTitledName]'s challenge stems from me not observing werewolf traditions and values.  If I were to adopt those, the challenge would be averted.
I'll adopt the werewolf way of life
No, the old ways are best.
The challenge continues as planned

[challenger.GetTitledName]'s challenge claims that I am not a werewolf, which would make me unfit to rule.  I've been keeping my condition secret, but if I reveal myself, the challenge would be canceled
Time to make myself known
No, I won't be pressured like this.

The challenge claims that werewolves will only be ruled by one of their own.  If I reveal myself as a werewolf and live with the werewolf culture and customs, [challenger.GetTitledName] would have to back off.
Time to reveal myself
No, I won't be pressured like this.
My liege has agreed to adopt a proper werewolf way of life.  While this is an improvement, it means I've lost the basis for my challenge against [defending_party.GetHerHim].
There will be other opportunities.

I will be [challenged_party.GetHerHis] champion!
[challenged_party.GetHerHisCap] father do it.
[challenged_party.GetHerHisCap] mother do it.

Sadly, the vassals have come out in support of the usurper, [challenger.GetBestName] rather than their rightful liege.  While this is disheartening, this is not a battle of popularity, but claws and steel.
I will not let them down.
I will show them who their true [challenged_party.GetTitle] is.

I have kept my nature a secret and it has brought me this opportunity – because [second_turn.GetTitledName] does not know I am a werewolf, if I shift and attack, I should catch [second_turn.GetHerHim] off guard.[Root.Not_transformed]

[second_turn.GetTitledName] is haughty and overconfident.  [second_turn.GetSheHeCap] thinks this will be an easy battle because [second_turn.GetSheHe] is a werewolf and I'm not.  [second_turn.GetSheHeCap] is wrong on both counts.[Root.Not_transformed]

The fight must surely look one-sided to any onlooker – a lowly human who took a werewolf's throne fighting against the strongest side of both man and wolf.  Wait until they see the truth – I am a werewolf and their true [Root.GetTitle]![Root.Not_transformed]
I'll reveal myself and charge in!
For now, I should keep my secret and fight normally.
No, I'll just focus on defense right now.
No, I'll just keep my distance for the moment.
As the fight goes on, my blood is pounding through my veins and my sight turns red.  There's no need to hold back now.  I give in to the wolf and let my rage take over.

My heart pound.  My muscles strain.  My mind is focused on one thing - ripping out [second_turn.GetTitledName]'s throat with my own teeth.  There's no reason to hold back.  I'm an animal and I'll fight like one.
This is how a werewolf fights!
I seem to have [second_turn.GetTitledName] on the defensive – I should use this opportunity to keep things that way.[Root.Not_transformed]
Our battle rages on.  Through the blows and movement, I see the opportunity to attack.[Root.Not_transformed]
Our battle is fierce and we are well matched, but the opportunity to strike is at hand.[Root.Not_transformed]
As the battle continues, neither has us is in the position for anything fancy, but I still need to strike.[Root.Not_transformed]
We are deep in the rush of battle – my heart is pounding and we are each at each others throats.  I need to find a way to gain the upper hand.[Root.Not_transformed]
Attack! Attack! Attack!
Charge in!
Press in and drive [second_turn.GetHerHim] back!
Fight cautiously and keep your defenses up.

Take a huge swing at [second_turn.GetHerHim].
Hack at [second_turn.GetHerHis] limbs!
Focus on defense.
Keep your distance.
Go in with all your might!
No quarter!
Focus on dismembering [second_turn.GetHerHim].
During the fight, my opponent was not watching [second_turn.GetHerHis] footing, and briefly lost [second_turn.GetHerHis] balance.  I can't pass up this opportunity.[Root.Not_transformed]

My enemy has not been careful with [second_turn.GetHerHis] feet and the ground is not are sure as [second_turn.GetSheHe] would think.  After one bad step, I can turn the fight in my favor.[Root.Not_transformed]
Charge [second_turn.GetHerHim] while [second_turn.GetSheHe] can't defend!

Throw all your might into a single, powerful blow!

As the fight continues, my opponent's injuries are sapping [second_turn.GetHerHis] strength.  It seems [second_turn.GetHerHis] pain flared up, as [second_turn.GetSheHe] grabbed [second_turn.GetHerHis] side for a moment, giving me the opening I need.[Root.Not_transformed]
Strike while [second_turn.GetHerHis] guard is down!
Aim for [second_turn.GetHerHis] injury and make it worse!
Press the attack so [second_turn.GetSheHe] doesn't have time to recover!
In the middle of the battle, the pain from my injuries swelled to unbearable levels.  I can't fight well through this agony.[Root.Not_transformed]
I need to focus on defense to stay alive.
I need to keep my distance to stay alive.
Fight through the pain.
There has been a slight lull in the combat – just enough that I think I can cast a spell to turn the tide of battle.[Root.Not_transformed]
I will bring [second_turn.GetHerHis] worst fears to life.
I will create copies of myself so [second_turn.GetSheHe] doesn't know what to dodge.
I will summon a spectral warrior to attack from behind.
I will weave an enchantment to cloud [second_turn.GetHerHis] mind and senses.
The battle has pushed me to my limit.  I can barely stand.  I just need a moment to catch my breath.[Root.Not_transformed]
I'm exhausted.  I need a moment to catch my breath before I can fight again.[Root.Not_transformed]

One of my less scrupulous supporters appears have have sabotaged [second_turn.GetTitledName]'s equipment.  It doesn't appear that [second_turn.GetSheHe] has noticed, so I can use this to my advantage.[Root.Not_transformed]
In the fight, I noticed some unusual damage to [second_turn.GetFirstName]'s equipment.  One of my supporters must have performed a bit of sabotage.[Root.Not_transformed]
I should take advantage of this, and strike where they are undefended
Attack normally – I must fight honorably
Oh, sweet [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName], I'm going to die!  This is more than I can take.  Maybe I should just get out of here while I still can.[Root.Not_transformed]
[second_turn.GetTitledName] is pushing me harder than I expected.  My knees are shaking and my heart if racing.[Root.Not_transformed]
I think I've gotten in over my head.  My heart is pounding, I'm breathing more heavily than I should, and I can't stop thinking that I'm going to die here.[Root.Not_transformed]
I'm out of here!
Just keep defending!
Keep [second_turn.GetHerHim] away from me!
Try to attack to keep [second_turn.GetHerHim] away!
Run away while I still can!
Flee for my life!
It appears that I was wrong about [From.GetTitledName] – [From.GetSheHe] is a werewolf.  [From.GetSheHeCap] shifted and manged to catch me off-guard with a brutal attack.
It appears that I was wrong about [From.GetTitledName] – [From.GetSheHe] is a werewolf.  [From.GetSheHeCap] shifted right in front of me and I barely managed to dodge [From.GetHerHis] blow.
[From.GetTitledName] came at me some decent strikes, and unfortunately a few managed to get through.
[From.GetTitledName] made a good effort at hitting me, but none of [From.GetHerHis] blows found their mark.
[From.GetTitledName] has been focusing on keeping a solid defense up.  I'll need to find a way around it if I wish to hurt [From.GetHerHim].
[From.GetTitledName] is unrelenting.  [From.GetSheHe] made several brutal blows, and I'm afraid I couldn't avoid all of them.
[From.GetTitledName] is overconfident.  [From.GetSheHe] came at me with several ferocious attacks, but no finesse – they were all easily avoided.
[From.GetTitledName] charged right at me!  I tried to block the blow, but [From.GetHerHis] momentum still carried the attack through.
[From.GetTitledName] charged right at me!  Did [From.GetSheHe] really think I couldn't dodge such a simple attack?
[From.GetTitledName] stuck with a series of blows while advancing without relent.  I had to back off to avoid being completely overtaken.
[From.GetTitledName] tried to advance on me, but I was able to keep [From.GetHerHim] at bay.
[From.GetTitledName] tried to keep me at bay with a series of quick, almost frantic attacks.  I regret that a few nicked me, but the blows carried little force behind them.
[From.GetTitledName] made a bunch of light, frantic blows.  I just hung back and let [From.GetHerHim] tire [From.GetHerselfHimself] out.

[From.GetTitledName] rushed at me, shouting about destroying my false god and striking down [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName].  I was caught off-guard by the sudden ferocity, that [From.GetSheHe] managed to land some heavy blows.

[From.GetTitledName] rushed at me, shouting about destroying my false god and striking down [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName].  [From.GetHerHisCap] wild swings were just as misguided as [From.GetHerHis] strange religion.
[From.GetTitledName] is stronger than I thought.  I tried to block one of [From.GetHerHis] blows, and it almost forced me to my knees.
[From.GetTitledName] is getting reckless.  While [From.GetHerHis] blow certainly had a lot of power behind it, it was so slow that an untrained servant could dodge it.
[From.GetTitledName] has been focusing on hitting my arms and legs for a while now, and it seems to be working.  I think [From.GetSheHe] intends to cripple me.

I'm not sure what [From.GetTitledName] is trying to accomplish – those last blows weren't anywhere close to anything vital.  Maybe [From.GetSheHe] could eventually nick a limb, but nothing that won't heal.
[From.GetTitledName] charged right at me!  It looked like is should have been easy to dodge, but I lost my footing and got hit rather hard.
[From.GetTitledName] leapt at me.  Between the force of the impact and some poor footing on my part, I hit the ground hard.
[From.GetTitledName] threw all of [From.GetHerHis] effort into this attack.  I'd hoped to dodge it and create an opening, but I lost my footing and took the full force of the blow.
The pain from my injuries are getting to me.  I flinched for just a moment, and [From.GetTitledName] used the opening to land some solid hits.
[From.GetTitledName] managed to land a blow on one of my existing injuries.  The pain is terrible, and the damage will probably last a while.
I think [From.GetTitledName] can see that my pain is getting to me and has renewed [From.GetHerHim] assault as a result.  The pain is making it hard to dodge, and some of those blows got through.
I think [From.GetTitledName] can see that my pain is getting to me and has tried to take advantage of it.  Fortunately, I'm still strong enough to dodge [From.GetHerHis] attacks.
[From.GetTitledName] has put some curse or hex upon my mind!  My vision is filled with terrifying images and I just need them to stop!

My eyes don't deceive me – [From.GetTitledName] has used [From.GetHerHis] magic to make copies of [From.GetHerselfHimself] to attack me from all sides.  While I dodged one, another stuck me from the side!

You receive a new ambition option for 3 years.
Mighty [Root.GetFirstName], the gods see all and show it through the flame.  Your soul is pure as gold.  You can improve no further in this mortal life.
Great [Root.GetFirstName], the gods see all and show it through the flame.  You have improved much – the only hindrances left to you are those placed upon you at birth.
The flames see all, and the flames show all.  Seek gold to purify your soul.  Own it, cherish it, sleep on in, and let it make you whole.  Just do not eat it.
The flames show what tarnishes your soul.  Beyond the simple lack of gold, you are in debt.  Gold purifies the soul and your cannot be pure while your gold is owed to others.
The gods speak and the priests listen.  They tell that your commitment to them could be greater and your observances of the rituals more thorough.  Become more pious, and you will become purer.
Every dragon is expected to lend their breath to the Eternal Flames, yet clearly you have not.  Please correct this immediately.
If you were to control one of the Eternal Flames, the gods would favor you.  Reclaim one of them from the infidels.
Worldly power shows strength and brings opportunities.  Claim a higher title and reap the rewards.
The flames show all.  Your marriage to a human weakens the blood and your soul.  They are few of us left and we must make a return.  Set aside your unworthy partner and web a proper dragon.
The gods see all.  You lay with humans, which corrodes your soul.  Set them aside if you wish to be pure.
The gods see all.  Your heir is not a dragon.  If they were to inherit, the realms would fall out of draconic control.
Pestilence wracks through you, mind, body, and soul.  Give it time or seek healing, and it will pass.
Human, your weak soul poisons that of your [Root.GetHusbandWifeOpp].  Set [Root.GetHerHimOpp] aside so that [Root.GetSheHeOpp] may wed a proper dragon.
Human, you bed dragons and lead them away from purity.  Set them aside so they may wed proper dragons.
Human, we do not have time to deal with your petty concerns.  Begone, this council attends to draconic matters.
Human, you have achieved a level of purity quite rare for your kind – you are a perfect servant.  Perhaps in the next world, you may even be a dragon.
Human, you are a fine servant.  The only impurities that remain in you are those put upon you by birth.
Human, fame brings honor and hard work brings fame.  Work hard, and glory shall purify you.
The human soul is one of iron.  It is strengthened through hard work.  Diligence is more than a simple lack of sloth – strive for more.
Human, you do yourself credit, but you have a higher purpose than selfish fame.  Humans were meant to serve dragons.  Humble yourself before a dragon lord and achieve fulfillment and purity.
Well, done human. You serve dragons with your authority.  You could do more if you held more power, though.  Seek a higher title while remaining in support of dragonkind.
Human, you show wisdom and purity, which you should put to good use.  Seek to be of council to those above you, so they may be guided to purity as well.
You have enough draconic ancestry that you can still lend your strength to the Eternal Flames.  Do so, and you will find your soul strengthened.
Human souls are strengthened by hard work, yet you avoid effort at all costs.  If you wish to strengthen your soul, You must work and diligently see your tasks through to the end.
Speechcraft is an art, a way of opening door, forging peace, and striking deals.  You must improve in this area if you wish to be of better service to dragons.
The art of war is a matter of life or death, a road to either safety or to ruin, and can on no account be ignored.  You must improve in this area if you wish to be of better service to dragons.
The craft of business is one of the surest ways to gain gold.  As such, its value to a dragon is beyond measure.  You must improve in this area if you wish to be of better service to dragons.

Many of the enemies of the dragons are humans, and another human could more easily move amongst them where one dagger in the night could do more work than an entire army. You must improve in this area if you wish to be of better service to dragons.

This world has many mysteries, both physical and mystical.  One who learns those secrets can gain the favor of the gods and bend the will of metals and machines.  You must improve in this area if you wish to be of better service to dragons.

If your rush for power, you have sacrificed the purity of your soul.  Like your body, you soul is shifting.  It is fluid, unstable, and poisonous like quicksilver.  This will give you a weaker standing in the next world, and cannot be undone.
You should be dead, but instead of waiting for the new world to be born, you cling to this one while your soul rots.  If you do not allow death's release soon, there may be no soul left.
Fame and glory are not only powerful tools, but a balm for the soul.  Seek to increase your prestige and esteem.
Wherever I go, bards and minstrels are reciting or singing my poems. I've gained the §YPoet§ trait.
I should be more careful about the [Root.GetMenWomenPreference] I sleep with.  I have become §YSyphilitic§!
Perhaps charging first into the breach isn't great for my health.  I have lost the §YBrave§ trait.
Over time, my injuries have lessened and I can I can move freely.  I have lost the §YWounded§ trait.
